description:
I found this place at first randomly walking.
This place is awesome. This is true authentic Mexican Food. It's also cheap and fast. You have to try the tamales with the green sauce! It's a little spicy so if your weak with spice don't put it on top.  
I'm happy I came in. The owner was very sweet and told me how they make everything in house. The food reminded me of a place I went to in Tulum,Mexico. thanks for the great food and memories.
author: L L.

description: I had 2 enchiladas, mashed pinto beans, rice, and chips with salsa for dinner today. It was so fresh and tasty, not greasy or fatty like a lot of Mexican food can be! Also the man and woman working there (the owners I presume) are endearing and clearly take a lot of pride in their service and quality of food. Glad to have this place nearby my home.
author: Kelsey B.

description:
Very casual neighborhood spot that I would have never known about if my office wasn't next door. 

I've ordered take out several of times from there and it's always delicious, authentic and fresh.
The beef burrito is very tasty, and reasonable priced.

The people who work there are nice, hard working people. Albert the owner, is very kind and always in a great mood. Very refreshing. 

NOTE- there is no seating, strictly a take out spot. There is a bench outside that you sit on.
author: Tati C.

description: Ordered take out for lunch here the other day. I work right across the street and I'm always looking to try new places for lunch. I thought this was very middle of the road. I had 1 pork taco, one vegetarian taco, and one vegetarian tamale. The tamale was very one note for me. Was definitely missing some cheese. The pork taco had good taste but the pork was dry and it needed something to add some juiciness. The vegetarian taco was my favorite and I would order that again. I may have just ordered the wrong things. I will give them another shot.
author: Emily S.

description: I love the crispy veggie tacos here! The contrast of a yummy, crunchy shell with the softness of the beans and cheese with the crispness of the lettuce and freshness of the pico de gallo... my mouth waters as I think about it. That said, I've enjoyed some of the other tacos on soft tortillas and look forward to exploring other items on the menu too.
author: Carey C.

description: The only Mexican take-away restaurant in the Marina, and much needed. Family owned and operated. The ladies are great and the food is tasty, especially the salsas. Grab a taco and cruise Union Street!
author: Mike H.

description:
Atmosphere:
Very casual. 

Interior:
Small interior
no indoor seating (there is an outdoor bench if want to eat there)
Clean restrooms.

Service:
The older gentleman is the sweetest man ever. His wife can be a little moody but also very nice. 

Food:
Menu has a lot of options that are price friendly! This is authentic home-style Mexican food in the Marina people! 

My usual  Order:
those Tacos though!  YUM!

Cons:
Can take forever to get your order-call ahead.

Overall:
Very good meal.
Cheap but excellent.
author: Nicky V.

description: La Canasta makes my favorite Chile Colorado burrito since I was a child. I can never get enough!
author: Justine V.

description: I just moved to the building next door and craving some tacos and figured I'd walk downstairs to check this place out. Had a great conversation with Alberto, the owner, as the lady behind at the stove cooked up my tacos. I ordered the al pastor and the original chicken. Just for the al pastor taco she put two pieces meat on the grill ... both tacos were decently stuffed with meat and a nice amount of toppings. I went spicy and it definitely had a heated kick. I thought both tacos has quality ingredients, filling and well priced. My new neighborhood spot to head back to!
author: Aryn C.

description: Not only is this my favorite Mexican food in the Marina, it has to be the friendliest service I've had in San Francisco. I love the variety on the menu. I love chatting with the business owners. Prices are fair for SF.
author: Charles K.

description: Best bang for your buck for a veggie burrito in the marina. The man who works there is very nice and the food is usually very tasty. Sometimes his wife has been withholding with salsa and once my burrito was rolled terribly, but all in all it's a good place.
author: Morris G.

description: Ummm... YUM! I took a stab in the dark here! but I work a few blocks from this delicious burrito spot. Also, I am pregnant, so tastiness matters to me very much at this point! I ordered a shredded chicken burrito and it was YUMMY! The chicken was moist and had a nice flavor.  The ingredients were evenly distributed through out the burrito and well balanced ( not too much rice). Fresh Guacamole and it was JUST the right size for lunch. I actually want another one right now! Thanks La Canasta!
author: Camie L.

description:
I went to La Canasta the other day because it is close to where I work and I have to say that I was thoroughly impressed! The prices are affordable if you opt for the "regular" burrito. If you upgrade and get the "grande" the price increases substantially. The size of the burrito doesn't seem to change depending on whether you get the grande or the regular, you just get more ingredients in the grande like guacamole and cheese. That being said, I would rather pay the lower price for the regular.

I got the chile relleno burrito and added avocado. It was so tasty! I never had chile relleno in a burrito so that was a very interesting touch. I would recommend it to anyone! 

This place is so tiny and cute, and most of all, it feels authentic! Now I have never been to Mexico, but I feel like this place is the closest I can get to that authentic feel without going to LA or Mexico.
author: Kaitlyn F.

description: Authentic Mexican food for great prices. Take out only. The pollo burrito with hot sauce was tasty and shredded beef tamale was also good. I ordered over the phone and it took about 15mins to be ready
author: Gracie N.

description:
Simply my favorite Mexican take out in the city. I have been going there for years.
Traditional food, fresh ingredients, delicious salsa and the sweetest staff.
author: Marc G.

description: La Canasta has been there 30 plus years. Great then and great now. My favorite burrito in SF and top two nationally because of the sustained consistency. I've bought over a hundred over the 30 years and never a bad roll or bad components.
author: Marty V.

description: For sure the best place to get mexican food in the area!!! Especially meat dishes. The people there are super nice and will quickly make your food. Whenever I get he chance I always order and have yet to disappoint. Their salsa has a pretty good kick. The food is good for the prices and much better than most of the area.
author: Abraham R.

description: Stopped in here for a burrito after not having been by for a few years and was sorely disappointed. Expensive, small, tasteless. I remember this place being much tastier and less expensive. My $10 didn't get me much . Won't be back.
author: Andy R.

description: This hole in the wall Mexican place off of Union Street has delicious homemade guacamole and great carnitas burritos!!!
author: Katie P.

description:
Hit the spot on a day when a #burrito was the only thing that would fill the void. I am glad I called ahead, because the lady who prepares the orders moves a bit slowly, but it turned out to be worth the wait. My super chicken burrito was quite tasty - even though the chicken could have used a bit more seasoning. 

My burrito buddy enjoyed his enormous carnitas burrito.

This place is a good pitstop if you're ever in need of a portable meal in the Marina.
author: Carole B.

description: It's healthy, it's authentic and isn't overpriced. You can order takeout and eat it on their benches outside.
author: Evelyn Z.

description:
I have gone here multiple times. The man who always takes my order is really nice. They can customize your order to some extent and it doesn't even cost extra.

They are really fast and it is incredibly cheap if you don't turn anything super. 

I usually go back because of convenience and and price.

The food is alright for SF, but nothing spectacular. However, i'm vegetarian and only have the vegetarian options.
author: Neil P.

description:
This is the worst Mexican place I've ever ordered from. I ordered off of Postmates. I ordered $28 worth of Mexican food:

-Guacamole
-Camaron Taco
-Sour Cream
-Quesadilla
-Garden Veggie Grande Burrito
-Mexican Rice

I don't think this restaurant has had the opportunity to invest in a simple saltshaker or they've never seen what salt can do.

 Salt. Can. Give. Life. To. Food. 

This food was the blandest food in the world. Blander than a single grain of white rice. The tacos and tortillas were soggy and wet at the bottom of my to-go container. The quesadilla cheese was dried and HARD. The veggie burrito had zero taste. 

The Camaron Taco had ONE shrimp. Let me repeat: ONE. 

C'mon guys. It's Mexican food. The simplest food ever! You literally throw stuff on a tortilla and these people STILL got it wrong. 

My advice? Pick a restaurant that has the ability to use a saltshaker.
author: Dennis A.

description: Save your money this place was the biggest ripp off in San Mateo  I ordered a super pollo asado burrito an for 10$ I expected a decent size burrito an was charged extra if I wanted jalapenos Wich did not make sense to me cause the girl at the counter referred me to ther salsa bar we're if I served them myself there wud be no charge . Anyway it was very small an at best had three little pieces of chicken an the rest was stuffed with beans .if I wanted a bean burrito I cud have went to taco Bell. The salsa at best was not spicy at all an it actually tasted like something in it was rancent an foul anyway I used to go to the one in the mission but parking was always hard to find  next time I don't mind spending time looking for parking caus San Mateo la cumbre caters to a downtown crowd that has never tried the S F location
author: Tom S.

description: This place has been home for the last 3 years. It is affordable for the Marina district and consistent. The old man is super sweet and takes the time to listen to your order. I'm vegetarian and somewhat picky about what I want on my burrito. He get's it right everytime. At this point I just walk in and he knows my order which a lot of places don't take the time to get to know their customers anymore. Really love this place and recommend it to others.
author: Paisley L.

description: Low key, slow cooked and done well. Home cooked quality, great neighborhood Mexican joint
author: W N.

description:
Amazing food. Nice people. Lower than average prices. 5 stars.
Its for sure gonna be my new favorite quick grab n go spot in the marina !
author: Albara H.

description: Amazing food.chile verde is amazing. Best I have had in SF. Do not expect giant plates of tex mex food, bubbly staff or seating space. Expect good quality slow cooked food for a very good price (but smallish portions)
author: Pablo N.

description: Not the best burrito especially compared to some Mission spots, but definitely pretty dec for $5-6 for in and out service in the Marina when you're hungry.
author: Aria S.

description: Casual neighborhood spot that has delicious Mexican food and such lovely ladies making the food! Love the taco platters which are always a ton of food. Great option for burritos as well. Plus, they have Topo Chico!
author: A S.

description: This is a terrific no-frills little place with a good selection of menu items. The food is simple, authentic, and excellent. The prices are very reasonable and the service is good. I would love to pick up food from here again if time allows on this trip. No tables, but if you're looking for quality takeout, give this place a try.
author: Melissa D.

description: I've been coming to this place for years. The owners are really some of the nicest people I've ever met. They are very kind and remember a lot about me which makes for fun conversations whenever I am there. There food is amazing and I highly recommend people to go to their restaurant for some pretty good mexican food.
author: Paul B.

description:
This place is a little Mexican gem on the corner of Buchanan, one I've never even heard of despite working in the area for a while.

You can say that the term "gem" usually does not refer to a place that I don't even rate 4 stars, but in reality, there are not many places to grab a decent burrito on Union Street if you work in the area and can't go far.

I was VERY surprised by how friendly the staff is, especially the man who handles the cash register who I assume is most likely the owner. The reason I was surprised about the service  is because the place actually uses grills rather than steam pots that keep the food warm. I think it's pretty great, because every single person who orders is getting fresh meat straight off the grill, rather than food that's been sitting there for a while. Also, despite numerous people waiting for their order at a time, the owner never feels pressured or rushed and always converses with the people there.

The food itself was NOT bad at all. I would say that it was average. My definition of average is probably different than others as someone who has ate at many, many burrito places in the past. I've definitely had amazing burrito's far above average in the Mission, so if I'm not doing a comparison and being less picky, I would definitely bump this review to a 4 star, as the place itself is pretty good and worth a try.

Highly recommend this place is you are craving Mexican on a work day and are in the area.
author: Alex B.

description:
I never do Yelp reviews unless I have a great experience. This place has been around for over 20 years and there is a reason why. It is good traditional Mexican food at a great price. I always get the pollo burrito. Places like this don't exist in cow hollow and need to be supported especially as neighborhoods and rent prices keep going up. 

Alberto is the sweetest man and if you go there often he always gives you food on the house. He really enjoys talking with his customers and I am so glad I found this place! Definitely a hidden gem in a over commercialized district of the city.
author: W H.

description: This little hidden Mexican take-out gem is a great spot to grab a quick bite! Staff is very patient and friendly. Food is relatively cheaper than most Mexican places located in the Marina. Unfortunately, It feels very "white washed Mexican" with lack of spicy or flavor.
author: Julian T.

description: I have been eating here for the last 7 years no complains, food is excellent, be patient; tasty food takes time to be prepared! Call ahead for pickup, no tables, but there are 2 benches outside for casual eating.
author: Zac H.

description: So I have walked this place at least 100 times and never stopped because my go to is Tacko. While I was at Tacko last week someone told me to try this place. I went today and just like the reviews the staff is very friendly. The man that helped me was super nice. As for the food, I ordered the fajita steak burrito with the spicy salsa, peppers, onions, and black beans. It was great I have to say and very filling. For $7.35 you cannot find anything in this neighborhood to compete with that. I will be back many more times after today.
author: Drew P.

description: Best burritos. Sweetest people. Fresh ingredients and hard working, family oriented people.
author: Theresa B.

description:
Take out or delivery ONLY. 
Very nice people, but the food is mediocre. Tacos get very soggy almost immediately and cannot be picked up, so you will likely need to eat them with a fork. The enchilada had green sauce which I honestly could not force myself to eat, though the filling was okay. Tamales are extremely dry, and come with a small (think tiny dipping sauce) container of black beans instead of salsa, and was not worth eating. Shrimp burritos are okay, but definitely far from the best in town - part of this may be because they seem to microwave the shrimp instead of freshly cook it. Also, their spicy salsa is less hot than most medium jars of salsa, and kind of a let down. 
I don't think I'll be going back.
author: Christy C.

description: LOVE LOVE LOVE finally some authentic Mexican outside of the mission. The owners are so sweet and the prices are super reasonable.
author: Beau D.

description:
A decent and cheap taqueria in the marina. Nothing too special about it. 

One of the only Mexican places in the marina that delivers, which is probably how you'll discover it on an afternoon following a day with too many fireball whiskeys. The guacamole is a little sketchy, pretty sure there's a 55 gallon drum of it in the back that arrived a few years ago.

Los Hermanos is a recommended alternative if you can manage to get outside without falling over.
author: William M.

description: Great spot.  The burritos are always delicious.  It's a grab and go spot, no seating, you won't be disappointed. Authentic family spot that has been there for 30 years ! Go support these good people and enjoy some delicious food.
author: P D.

description:
I am so happy to have found this place on my lunch break today. This place is a gem.
It doesn't break the bank and the food is amazing. I'm a huge fan of Mexican food, so this PSA is legit LOL. 
The food, prices & customer service is all AWESOME. 
I'm beyond pleased. 
Check them out !
author: Zuri I.

description: Love this place! Comfort food for the soul. Quick, casual, delicious and so friendly. Can't wait to go back.
author: David S.

description: Alberto and his family are absolutely wonderful and clearly care about the quality of their food. It's a great pickup or oder in option if you're looking for Mexican in Cow Hollow/Marina District. They have tons of options, but my favorite is the fajitas. The burritos seem to be the most popular there. Order ahead so it's ready when you get there!
author: Jeri D.

description: Great food! Burritos are the best! They are a little slow BUT we'll worth the wait. Enjoy....
author: Anthony V.

description: Just ordered through postmates & thought it was pretty good, prices very reasonable. I heard the soup is great, I'll try that next time but I had the crunchy chicken tacos and small burrito and would order again. Good neighborhood small spot!
author: Sfgal S.

description: alberto is so friendly. the food is cheap and delicious!!! so consistent and authentic. i love love LOVE coming here, order out at least once a week.
author: Mallory V.

description:
The best Mexican food north of market st.  

This place is great specially since I live in the Marina and there are no other Mexican food restaurants in the area that compare to this one.  The service is very friendly and Don Alberto(owner) is a great guy.  I usually come twice a week and the burritos are my favorite specially the steak burro.

I highly recommend this place if you are looking for AUTHENTIC Mexican Food.. And before I forget, the also carry the delicious bottled sodas from Mexico like Coke, Sangria, Orange(fanta) and Strawberry...

Try it.. you wont regret it...
author: Carlos M.

description:
We went here because the place around the corner serving 12 dollar sandwiches looked like they took themselves a little too seriously. (Loosen up: it's all the same in the end.) I'm glad we did because you appreciate food when you watch the person make it ten feet away. The food was good, and fresh, and we liked how they had "mild," "hot," and a third temperature which sounded like the second but came with a smile that indicated someone likes to watch hipsters go to the hospital. 

I enjoyed the food and moreover liked giving them my money a lot more than the other places in the area that looked like they needed money like a lobster needs earmuffs. 

The bad reviews for this place are so disgraceful it's funny - some guy and his wife are making you food out of a place too small to do shoe repair, and all the complaints are that their delivery takes too long. Have you actually seen the place? Come on, man. If gas is that expensive walk there, or skateboard, or segue or invent some other new mode of transportation that no one can use anywhere with a climate. Lemme see... let's retrofit Pogo Balls with jet-ski motors. Lazy gits.  

Pros:
Reasonably priced
Quick, well-prepared food
Locally owned. Like I think I saw into the living room from the register. 

Cons: 
No indoor seating
Should apparenly hire a new delivery badger.
author: Devin P.

description: Have been eating La Canasta food since they opened (original location on Filbert). Family run, excellent food, clean and always reliable. Their Empanadas are spectacular!!!!!  My friends/family and I get veggie burritos (for the most part), though the meat eaters in the group love their food as well. I now live in the Outer Richmond and my best friend lives on Treasure Island; we BOTH make the trip to La Canasta for our Mexican food fixes - totally worth it!!  Most of the negative comments I see are about the delivery, I have always hone in so I don't have any experience with it. I will say, this is a small, family owned business (the owner, Alberto does most if them); so please be patient. Or better yet, go in and pick it up - just made food always tastes the best!  Love, love, love La Canasta!!!!
author: Heather M.

description:
I absolutely love this place and have eaten here 2-3 times a month for the last 20 years!  Their carnitas are the BEST with delicious crispy bits and moist meat. I usually get their California chicken tacos or a steak fajita grande. Really good chips & guacamole too plus my beloved Mexican Coke :-)
The food is great but the best part about this restaurant is the lovely, lovely family that own and run it - Alberto & family are a neighborhood treasure.
Note: Although they have a couple of benches outside, this is strictly a take-out restaurant. If you are picking up, call ahead, this place is seriously busy and their phone rings off the hook. They will usually have your food ready in 15-20 mins. If you live in the Marina, Cow Hollow or Pacific Heights you are in luck, because they deliver to you!
author: Karen N.

description: Advantage in that one of the few Mexican places on the street although there are a couple of good places over on Chestnut. Food a little uninspired, toned down to the point of no flavor. But if your craving a burrito , this is the only gig around . Mas sabor por favor !
author: Matt A.

description: I ordered the pozole and was highly disappointed. Not only is it not authentic but it wasn't even edible. Absolutely no flavor, tasted like shredded pork in water with soggy cabbage, just awful.
author: Mirna C.

description:
Really appreciate the people that work here.  Pretty courteous and they deliver which is huge!
This is not a chipotle or tacko type of burrito place.  This is more authentic but not too authentic mexican food if you get what I mean.

If I could say anything else to try and sum this place up is that it is authentic and incredibly simple food.  Otherwise it is pretty delicious and I would recommend for a quick and easy burrito.
author: Alex A.

description:
Great service, great food!

Fajitas and burritos are my favorites. They are fast and all of the ingredients are good quality.
author: Kati D.

description:
Honestly, probably doesn't *truly* deserve 5 stars relative to the amazing burrito options we have in SF.  BUT - it is the best option anywhere North of Market street, and certainly the top choice in the Marina/Cow Hollow district!

La Canasta is still family-run, and every single item is made by hand.  I saw other reviews reference cold/soggy food, but I've never had that problem.  Love the flavor of the fajita chicken burrito, but my favorite is a combo with the chorizo as well.  

It sounds like the experience others have had has been all over the map, but I've been coming here for years - never a disappointment!
author: Jeremy T.

description: This place rocks. They are great people and serve the best Mexican food in the Marina. Everyone in San Francisco has their favorites down in the Mission - but La Canasta can totally hang with that crowd. The food is legit. I've been going to this place since the mid-1990's. I'm so glad that it's still here!
author: Phil L.

description:
Felt like good Mexican tonight!

To bad we didn't get it...

The chorizo burrito $6.95 was flavorless except for the chorizo.  It contained rice and beans, however it did not help.

The Al Pastor taco $3.45 was ok with the adobo pork and cilantro.

The Chile Relleno burrito $7.50 was ok with the chile relleno, once again, the rice and beans were meh.

California Taco $3.15 was ok with a fried flour tortilla, shredded beef, lettuce, taco sauce and a sprinkle of Mexican cheese.  Really? Taco sauce? What is that? Is that like Top Ramen's Oriental Flavor?

Maybe since I live in California I feel entitled to great Mexican food. So forgive me if I am a little harsh when a restaurant claims they are AUTHENTIC. I also make Mexican food at home from scratch, never from a bottle or can. Learned and perfected many dishes from my mentors.

Come here if you want eat to live, not to live to eat...

Food- 2 Stars
Service 3 Stars - friendly and patient
author: Cathy S.

description: I am a big fan of Mexican food and Chipotle. Yes, La Canatas burrito is kind of small for the price you pay for and compare to the fast food chain,but I would still give this place a good rating. The pollo burrito is great. The owner is the sweetest man ever, he enjoys chatting with his customers and even become good friends with his return customers. It is my first time at this place and he offers me a bag of tortilla chips. It just so good to have such a heart warming mom and pop store that serves delicious quality food in a commercialized neighborhood and did I mention the burrito is great!
author: Jens L.

description:
DO NOT order delivery from this place, horrible. 
Ordered 2 crunchy tacos, anything but crunchy, soggy. 
Quesadilla, soggy!  Rice, flavorless. 20 plus dollars and 1 hour later I'm still hungry cause everything I ordered was not edible and had to go straight in the garbage.
author: Tim L.

description:
I need to review this amazing establishment again, ignore any winey non understanding Marina girl or guy review on this place.  

The owners are simply amazing kind people, they offer the best mexican food with wholesome ingredients (no fat or lard in their re-fried beans) and the cost is reasonable enough that I question anytime I go anywhere else for lunch by my work.
author: DJ L.

description: Was craving Mexican food and wanted to try something different in the neighborhood so I stumbled on La Canasta. I'm so glad I did! The burritos were great and this a small family owned shop. If you're looking for a late night bite off of Union or are just in the mood for Mexican like I was - check out La Canasta!
author: Teresa C.

description: Outstanding!  While waiting for the bus, I got hungry. So I popped in and got a vegetarian taco. My belly is so happy now. And the man at the counter is possibly the nicest man in SF.
author: Kelly S.

description:
This is a little hole in the wall place that I love. It's in a great place along union street, and so there is a ton of stuff to do there in the area. Go do some shopping and stop by la canasta for a bite to eat. Cultivè frozen yogurt is next door, so yore right next to desert. However, la canasta often has a great selection of wedding cookies, but they run out fast !!

1. Good location. Union street so there is tons of shopping in the area and things to do. 

2. It's a small place but it's real authentic food.

3. You can order with the phone app GoPago

4. Quick and inexpensive.

5. Parking is difficult in the area.

6. Just a really nice neighborhood place.
author: Maryam T.

description:
Craving Mexican food? This is the place to go in the marina - no, the city!! Amazing tacos, tamales and burritos. Like, WOW! 

I live in the neighborhood and honestly eat La Canasta 3-4 times every week, without fail. Great and friendly service. Personable. 

Get the Chicken Fajita Tacos. Spicy. You'll thank me later.
author: Kit G.

description:
Open M - Sat till 9 p.m.

Positives:

1. FRIENDLY and COURTEOUS service

2. Fair prices

3. Good tacos

Negatives:

1. Awful burrito (chili colorado)

2. Good luck finding parking 

3. Not very quick (which would be okay if the burriots were good) since it's not a fast food place like taco bell
author: Jonah H.

description: Amazingly nice man that works there and great food! Wish I would've known about this place a while ago!
author: Karyssa S.

description: Most authentic Mexican food I've had in a long time and the service was great. The man behind the counter was extremely friendly and the food was all cooked fresh on the grill right in front of you. I would definitely go back.
author: Jared S.

description:
I really like the authentic, family vibe at La Canaste. The super small, almost closet sized location is unique and fun.  

They do not have tables inside, so you must take your food to-go or sit right outside on one of the benches. 

I sat outside on a sunny day and enjoyed my meal. I spilled some pretty nasty burrito juice on my black jeans like an idiot and the owner gentleman gave me a bunch of handy-wipes which I appreciated.  

The food here is solid and I especially like the chips, salsa and guac.
author: Andy C.

description: Best place I've ever been!! The old ladies make it so authentic, the chips are home made, the tortillas. If your near this place eat here.
author: Buido B.

description: I've eaten here for years.  Ingredients are very fresh.  They cook the steak and chicken while you wait.  The carne asada is the best.  The places (like this one) that throw the tortilla on the stove to heat it instead of in a steamer are hand made, that's a little pro-tip for you.  Run by nice family.
author: Mitori H.

description: This place is kinf a hole in the wall sort of across rom The Brick Yard.  Good for a quick chile relleno burrito.  I think its owned and run by a husband and wife. Portions are large and quality is good.
author: Tom F.

description:
It just took 2 hours to get 4 burritos delivered.  All 4 burritos were wrong, and all 4 were soggy and cold.  The "steak" was some kind of mystery meat.  BTW, we didn't order steak.  The "prawns" burrito came with 2 prawns.  The chicken tasted like bbq sauce.  That's right, bbq sauce.  We ended up throwing it all away.

Do yourself a favor and find somewhere else to get your mexican fix.
author: Nick G.

description:
Yeah, my experience with this place was really bad, here it goes:

I ordered a quesadilla a tostada and nachos from this place at 7 pm, it was supposed to take between 45 minutes and and hours to get to my place.

At 8:15 I called them and asked if there was something up, if we should be expecting our food anytime soon. She asked for our address, contacted the driver (I could hear the conversation) and the driver said he would be with is in 2 minutes.

8:30 came around, they stopped answering our calls, 8:40, 8:50, I kept thinking how our food would be cold and soggy by now, at 9 the driver called us, unable to speak English, asking where we were.

I told him our address again, have him 4 reference points, he kept saying no, and asking I we were up or down. 2 minutes into this bonkers phone conversation I finally figured what he wanted to know (our apartment was between which cross streets).

And I see a car, coming slowly into our block, he goes out, knocks on random door,  gets it wrong, goes to another building, wrong place, finally he got to our place dropped the food and did not give us a chance to check the food.


I mean, I took pictures of our dinner (it looks like breakfast cereal that was dumped into warm green and red milk that was way to warm for way to long) but, I mean, there is food that has a visual expiration date.


We were really really hungry so we tried to patch it up (take away the tortillas that were melting, put the quesadilla in the toaster) and we ate some of it.


At 3 am I woke up feeling like Alien was ready to be birthed, feeling like Cthulhu was angered and that my stomach was a kraken trying to break free.

I spent the rest of the night either cuddling the toilet or embracing a small baby blue bowl (when bile was all that was coming out) with two kids holding hands printed on the bottom (and acquire somewhere in jtown).

There you go. This is the update to the tip I gave last night.

Be warned.
author: Bea L.

description: Quality control has gone down some,  they are over-worked and short staffed.   I understand running a restaurant for over 25 years with only one day off a week and no time tor a vacation would weigh anyone down!  . They clearly don't care nearly as much as they used to,    I Hope someone can assist them or maybe help save the place.  IT IS NOT TOO LATE.
author: John C.

description: Best Burritos in SF. Chicken or carnitas supreme burritos are the best. Great prices, great service and quick! Family owned and super friendly. Have never had a bad experience. So delicious!!! 5 stars
author: AnnaMaria L.

description:
This is literally the worst burrito I've ever had in my entire life not to mention the burrito is tiny. Taco Bell makes better burritos then this place. The quality of  food is not even the worst part.... The older women who is the owner is truly the nastiest women in history. She's like a dragon if you ask her for anything she looks at you like she wants to rip your face off. Everything is a inconvenience for her. I was terrified to ask for black beans! It also took them 30 minutes to complete our order. . . I could have gone to Tacolicious on that amount of time. 

DO NOT GO HERE UNLESS YOU'RE A DRAGON TAMER!
author: Meredith A.

description: When you live in the Marina. Good Mexican is really hard to come by. The food here is always fresh and hot with a great flavor.  The service has always been amazing...
author: Cynthia F.

description: Carnitas burrito all the way. Super nice and friendly little shop :) looks like it's the locals Mexican food shop. Sooooo good! Would definitely recommend
author: Dana F.

description: One of the best Mexican food in the city run by very nice people . Good people make good food.
author: Seni F.

description: Prob will never order from this place again. Brown guac, flavorless burritos, didn't follow the order specifications that we added and gave us the same size burrito when we ordered one grande. This is what we get for being lazy and wanting delivery... I guess.
author: Kimberly P.

description: Awesome veggie burritos! I always ask to go easy on the guac and to spread some salsa over the beans before anything else gets added in and it's an amazing combo! They get A LOT of phone in and online orders, there may not appear to be a line here but there usually is a wait!
author: Kiran J.

description:
I submitted an order via their website and received an email confirmation.  After waiting the estimated 45 minutes (and then some), I called to check on the status.  Literally no one there speaks English, which is fine in this instance, since I speak Spanish.  I explained the problem, and the woman at La Canasta told me there was no record of the order.  When I explained that I was charged, she said to call the company who runs the website.  That company's policy is to issue no refunds, and to direct all complaints back to the restaurant.  So, in other words, this woman told me to chase my tail.  

I'm $25 lighter and I'm still hungry.  Thanks for absolutely nothing.
author: Doug T.

description:
I love coming to La Canasta for lunch!

This is a to-go only spot. They do have 2 seating areas outside, but no tables. 

The customer service is impeccable. Every time I go in, I leave in a better mood. Their food is great too. They actually are the closest thing I've found to the Mexican food I grew up on. 

I ordered the shrimp ceviche today and it was so fresh. I've tried a few different dishes and I've always been happy with both flavor and portion size. The food is very fresh, nothing is overly greasy, and its all made with care. They even package up everything for you so thoughtfully.

Definitely a great place to grab lunch even if you are trying to eat healthy, they have soup and salad options. 

This is a great local business that I love supporting. I hope they are around FOREVER!
author: Lizette C.

description: Delivery takes much longer than expected. We placed online order  at 8pm, it was supposed to be delivered in 45 mins. Foods arrived at 9.30 pm, cold and not so good. Never had tried their services on place, but delivery doesn't work
author: Selena S.

description:
not great. 

There are so many delicious Mexican restaurants to be had in SF, go elsewhere. 

delivery tonight
- two cold and soggy burritos
- stale chips
- watery salsa mostly made of onions and under-ripe tomatoes
- cold rice with a little oil and nondescript tasteless seasoning 
- a side of guac that tasted more of mayo than avocado
- the worst part; tortilla soup.... I'm pretty sure it was tomato juice, soggy tortilla strips, cilantro and a few pieces of onion.... horrible

don't order from this restaurant; choose another.

please note; my one star reviews are far and few between and carefully chosen.
author: Beth P.

description:
3.5 stars, but rounding up to 4 for service.

PROS:
-Quick and easy (takeout only)
-Cheap (definitely NOT overpriced)
-Delicious chalupa (*would come back just for this)
-Tasty torta (but see below)
-Friendly and genuine staff person

CONS:
-Tamales are a bit small and dry (but smothering them in sauce helps)
-The menu indicates that the Cochinita torta comes with lettuce, guacamole, onions, and tomatoes (none of which were found inside the torta)

I would like to try more--especially for the price.
author: Briana F.

description:
This is my favorite Cow Hollow / Russian Hill Mexican food.  This is definitely authentic and not healthy for you but tastes amazing.   Only place I have found that has real mexican rice, proper refried beans and cooks with lard.    The chorizo burrito is an orange grease dripping thing of beauty and nothing else comes close.

if you want healthy get the Nick's Crispy Tacos camarones burrito with black beans and cabbage.  If you want the perfect mexican hangover cure La Canasta is the place to go.

Side note -- Unless you speak spanish ordering over the phone can be difficult.   Also this is carry out only.
author: william c.

description:
Ordered delivery and the shrimp taco was so soggy I had to eat with a fork.  The steak burrito had almost no meat.  They sent no extra salsa, hot sauce, chips...nothing.
Probably the worst mexican I've had in several years.
author: John P.

description:
Came here after a 50% scoutmob coupon, ordered the carnitas torta and was very disappointed.  After waiting 10 minutes with no patrons in front, my sandwich arrived; the meat was extremely bland, the portions were less than adequate, the bread was stale, and it was "meh" at best.  

I'll look elsewhere when I'm in the area and looking for some authentic Mexican food; I recommend you do the same.
author: Natan O.

description:
I'll be honest, I'm not at all sure what they name means but La Canasta is one of my favorite spots to grab some cheap mexican food in the city. I come here a lot because they have tons of different items that I love. Whether I'm craving a burrito, taco, tamales, quesadilla, soups, salads or anything else you could ever order at a mexican restaurant, they've got it here and it's delicious. 

My personal favorite item on the menu: either the carnita burrito with sour cream or chile colorado tamale. Honestly I usually order both together, the tamales are only $2 a pop! How can you not?!

Cheap mexican food to help you stretch that dollar far and get some tasty food.
author: Elaine M.

description:
I work in the neighborhood and La Canasta is not exactly a quick lunch.. They take forever so make sure you call ahead!

The owner is very nice, although his staff is not the most friendly.  It has taken a while of me ordering from them consistently to not get a dirty look every time I come in.

But what saves them for me is the tortilla soup. Awesome! It is rare to find a tortilla soup with a vegetable broth base.. and they have it!  And they fry up the tortilla chips that accompany your order fresh everyday.  I haven't strayed too far off the menu because I love that soup so much, but my carnivorous boyfriend said his steak burrito was pretty good.

What you get for the price in the marina is pretty reasonable. My bowl of soup coming in it $3.95 is probably the cheapest lunch on Union St.  And since I don't live in this fancier side of town, I can appreciate the value.
author: Sam Marie G.

description: Best authentic Mexican food in town! Homemade tortillas, fresh made chips, amazing carne asadas, and huge burritos. It's a very small place and if you blink you'll miss it.  You order a main entree and you can add on sides such as rice, beans, or salsa. If you're ever on union street, definitely stop by here.
author: Eric M.

description:
I'm really surprised to see all the negative comments about this place. 

Although it's not the best looking of places, my friends and I decided to eat here after starving ourselves from an early morning hike. The place serves one of the best burritos I've ever eaten; and coming from Los Angeles, that's saying something (just kidding). Their tostadas and tamales were also pretty tasty and definitely worth the price. This take out restaurant is pretty small, but definitely brings out a cozy atmosphere. The staff itself is very quick and efficient at getting orders out in a timely manner (assuming there's no line). It's also pretty nice to see that everything was clean in the kitchen and that the food is freshly prepared by the employees. Overall, the food was genuinely authentic and delicious.
author: Angie Y.

description: Ordered delivery last night. Ordered from Palo Alto bc the kids were hungry (in the City) and wanted Mexican food. Ordered 2 burritos grande, two tacos hard shell, one nachos with beef. I drove 70 mins from Palo Alto in traffic, and there was no food at home when I arrived. I called the restaurant 3 times and each time was told it had left the restaurant already and would be there in 5 mins. Mind you, I live 4 blocks from the restaurant. I wait outside at the 2 hour mark and watch this guy go to the house across the street. Turns out he's at that house calling me, when I tell him he's at the wrong house. When he comes over (2:15 from order), I ask him what happened, and he jokes that his car goes slowly. Asks me to sign for the tip. Food was mushy, cold, and all 4 of us agreed we'd never order there again.
author: Nick S.

description:
I've always thought there isn't enough take-out/to-go options or Mexican restaurants along Union in the Marina. Well, then one day out of the corner of my eye on Buchanan I spotted La Canasta, and that killed two birds with one stone. 

First off, I'm not surprised at all by the number of people who've reviewed this place, and have specifically mentioned how nice the owner and employees are. IMO service with a smile can go a LONG way, and the guy who was working the counter (who I'm assuming was the owner) and the two women who were preparing the food up front all seemed genuinely happy and had big smiles on there faces the whole time I was waiting for my food. I even heard the owner asking one customer (who I'm assuming is a regular) about his family, and it sounded like he even knew his kids names! 

The place is tiny and takeout only. The menu is pretty standard Mexican food with nothing fancy. I decided to go with an order of nachos and added shredded chicken. It's kind of different how they do the nachos here, but I like it. They basically already have the chips in a plastic container and just add everything to it. This does make it a little difficult to eat as "nachos" (you'll need fork), but it still tastes good :) They also threw on some jalapenos for me since I like things spicy. 

I will say, considering this place is more "Mission-style" Mexican food, it's a little more expensive than places you'll find there, but still pretty moderately priced. I'm glad I know about La Canasta now, and I'll definitely be back to try some other things on the menu!
author: George A.

description:
This review is for delivery.

So this is the worst service I've ever had from a restaurant that does delivery. I started off by calling the place and the lady that answered kept getting my info wrong even though I tried to talk to her in Spanish since I'm fluent, yet she didn't understand that either. Second, the food arrived over and hour and a half after I ordered, WTH. Third, they charged me $17 for one burrito and a small side of guacamole, are you kidding me?! And on top of that it took almost two hours to get here??? Fourth, my burrito was soggy by the time it arrived. Fifth, the guacamole is extra salty as if people can eat like that, so gross I had to throw it out. 

This place is definitely not getting my business from now on. They only get one star because I can't give them 0.
author: Rosario N.

description:
La Canasta is the reason why I fell in love with Mexican food! My favorite thing to order is their tortilla soup with chicken. It's perfect for lunch! It's light but filling and won't leave you sleepy like burritos! 

I love the fact that it's family owned and the family is always super nice. When I use to work on Union and come by almost everyday, they would always throw in something for me-- nachos, drinks or those Mexican wedding cakes! While working at BCBG one night (about 2 blocks away) I couldn't leave the store to get food but my stomach was growling. So I called them and they delivered my food two blocks!

I'm a fan for life! :)
author: Tiffany U.

description:
This is a great neighborhood spot.
 the owner is super nice and the food is delicious. certainly tastes very authentic and fresh
it takes a little while to get your order but its worth it
author: Saran N.

description:
We have soft spots for hole in the wall joints so this place is one we've been wanting to try...well, a hole in the wall is definitely the case...a good spot not so much...

First of all, you don't smell anything when you walk in - how can a taqueria has no great aroma of some sort??  Well, maybe because everything is all made and just sitting there waiting for the next sucker to come in...like me.

Glad that we only ordered the carnitas taco ($3.60) and a small side order of spanish rice ($0.95).  Nothing was warm - the carnitas was super dry and not very flavorful.  The rice was not very tasty but a bit on the salty side.  

Skip.
author: Gloria H.

description: I've been a loyal customer of La Canasta for many years, and have had many great to-go meals and deliveries from their tiny retail location on Buchanan @ Union.  Most of my orders consist of their burritos- carnitas and carne asada are my regulars.  My most recent order was a disappointing, not so warm burrito where the cheese and internals had mixed temps and did not mesh well.  I'm giving them a pass, but won't forgive this again.  My business has been going more frequently towards Papalote and Nick's (for their fish burritos only) over the past few months, and I'm hoping my next order from La Canasta will help win me back as the owners are very nice and I have been a customer for more than a decade.  To be continued....
author: Andy S.

description:
The owner was pretty nice, he was talking and joking with us the whole time. 

The lady who was making the burrito was somewhat older and she didn't really was her hands. Between cutting up steak and picking up lettuce and cheese with her hands, she wiped it on her apron. Which doesn't seem all that bad until u think about how long that apron has been on her and we ordered food at around 9 pm...

The food was pretty decent. The flavors were fairly good and it wasn't so heavy like other burrito places. But I wish they put more meat/guacamole in the burrito. When I pay $9 for a burrito, I expect it to be chock full of carne asada and guacamole. 

Nice owners, good tasting but small portion sizes and partial uncleanliness keep it from reaching higher than 3 stars imo.
author: Wilson T.

description: I was surprised to find food for about $5 (the large burritos, tortas, and combo plates cost more) in this pricey area. There are no seats, so everything is to go. The guy behind the counter was very friendly, but sadly the food (chicken burrito) wasn't that great (everything seems overcooked). I couldn't finish my mushy burrito so I threw it away. If you get to try Taqueria Cancun or Mexico Tipico you'll be able to taste the difference.
author: Luis C.

description:
Kind of gross.  I ordered the fried tacos and torta and they were inauthentic and not worth returning for.  I grew up in San Jose and have lived in Santa Barbara and Los Angeles for a combined 8 years and although I'm not Mexican, I'd say I have a good nose for Mexican food. 

Fried Tacos:
Um, if you like refried/deepfried already-hard taco shells then go for it.  It was like biting into a semi-burnt tortilla.  Plus the salsa was this odd tomato paste stuff that was no where close to spicy or tasty.

Carnitas Torta:
Sad.  I LOVE carnitas and I'm not sure I'd be able to tell what kind of meat was in there because it was SO SO salty.  Salty like there was an accident and they poured a cup instead of a tsp.  I couldn't finish it.  It also had the same tomato paste stuff on it.

I'd give this place one star but it looked clean and I haven't had anything else on the menu (but you won't catch me in there again).

Pros:
They serve Jaritos!
The ladies behind the counter are sweet.

Cons:
Food is not very authentic or tasty.
author: Ryan T.

description:
What a let down.

I was excited to get the vegetable burrito, because I love Zona Rosa's vegetable burrito with zucchini, but this doesn't come anywhere close to that one. Zona Rosa cooks the fresh vegetables after you order them, and it's so yummy. Here, they pulled a bin from somewhere under the counter, and my burrito hardly had any vegetables in it at all - mostly beans and rice.

My friend got the carnitas, and felt sick later. 

Suddenly glad I got the vegetable burrito.
author: Susan W.

description: I've been going to La Canasta for years. Not a sit down place, but great to grab and go. Best Mexican food in the area. California Tacos are where it's at!
author: Sean R.

description:
Okay, I think small joints are a must to try anywhere in the city but I'll be skipping this place from now on. I read the reviews before ordering and I though it was the right choice for lunch. Boy was I wrong. I ordered a torta and it was terrible. They heated the meat in the microwave! WTH??? I was the only person there and it took them 12 minutes to make my torta. Including a soda my bill was like $11. Totally not worth it, not even half that amount. The only nice thing about the place was that the man was very friendly. 
I also agree with the other review and that the place had no aroma. It says a lot if you can't even smell the food. And the place was seriously only about 150 square feet so I should have smelled something.
Go to Chinos on 35th and Balboa.
author: Stormtrooper N.

description: Hands down the best veggie tacos in the city. Best value for your money and you don't have to walk through the seediest parts of town to get to it!! Family owned and operated and the owners are such sweethearts.
author: Marcus K.

description:
I'll be honest with you: the food was a 3 - 3.5, but the service was a 5. 

I walked in here for the first time the other day and the owner treated me like a son who had been away at war for a decade. 

This is old-school service. I was treated with respect and like I was family. 

I will definitely make a point of going back here if only to support their awesome owners. 

I had a carnitas burrito and it was of a decent size. It wasn't cheap (under $5). 

It's a hole in the wall, but definitely worth checking out.
author: Carlos A.

description:
It makes me laugh to read the girls' reviews about the whole "sink deal" (literally, LOL) ... clearly they have not worked in any sort of restaurant because if they have, they'd know that there's a whole lot worse than cleaning dishes in a tiny dinky sink that happens to be in a bathroom.

The irony is that when you walk in to La Canasta, even at its busiest, the place is IMMACULATE. They are always cleaning the food and counter areas to the point where they don't even need to. If the health department had a problem with them using a bathroom sink --- trust me, they'd be shut down in a heartbeat. You can view a list of EVERY restaurant in SF's health records by going on to the dept. of health's website and restaurant database. There are PLENTY of expensive restaurants that do way worse than use a bathroom sink to clean their dishes... and all you have to do is research! Fine dining don't mean the kitchen is safe, ya'll! Just remember: your dollars don't go toward cleaning or health requirements or making sure the kitchen staff isn't licking their fingers to try a soup or washing their hands after they pee :-)

Enough about that. On to the food:

La Canasta is the best cheap Mexican in the Cow Hollow/Marina area and the portions are glorious considering the prices. They are so friendly and pretty efficient considering the phone is ringing off the hook non-stop. So if you're far away from the Mission and you're looking for a quick Mexican fix, head on by. You won't be disappointed.
author: Meredith R.

description:
Some impulse decisions you end up regretting. And it's rare you get a second chance. Such was the case at La Canasta.

It was hunger love at first sight when I saw the steamed veggie burrito on the menu. Without spending much time looking at other offerings, I placed my order. Friendly cashier, lots of amigo this and amigo that, black beans were on the way, as was their wheat/flour tortilla blend.

Then she came in. Minding her own business, having no idea she'd change my life, she ordered a grilled chicken fajita burrito. I watched as the chicken was placed over a grill, cooked to perfection without any sketchy oil or additives. Just chicken and fire. As it should be.

I was jealous. I was disappointed in myself. I knew time was running short to speak up. Finally I made my way back up to the cashier, and asked with the most polite of tones, could I add some of that grilled chicken on too? No problem my amigo.

The steamed veggies and grilled chicken ended up being a wonderful combo. Here's to second chances, and having them pay off deliciously.
author: Jason B.

description:
I know a good burrito when I see it. I'm from the central valley and was longing for a good taco truck burrito, ordered (very nice people, good customer service), took it to go. I arrived at my apartment as was very disappointed. Should have just got Chipotle. 

Pros:
Good Location
Good Customer Service

Cons:
Bad Burrito Folding
Placement of Fillings
author: Edgar G.

description: We ordered delivery and were more than disappointed. Soggy and super bland burritos. Awful.
author: Jacqueline G.

description:
Listen up - if you like those dripping greasy burritos with crappy meat - go to the MIssion.

If you actually like burritos that taste great and don't make you hate yourself, then hit up Canasta.

Likes:
1) Carne asada and pollo asada are both lean meat, grilled to order on a real grill - not some slab of hot metal that's greased up like a WWE wrestler.

2) All of their stuff is homemade.  And they ensure that it's all healthy - por ejemploo - the black beans don't have lard like most joints.  And they cook with heart healthy oils.

3)  Been going here for about 10 years now and I've tried to find a comparable burrito.  I can't.  And I don't like Pancho Villa/El Farolito grease pits.  I don't get those places.  Oh yea, people are wasted when they eat there.  Of course they think they're good.

4) They have habanero sauce!  Don't know why this isn't a staple?

5) Love the owner, super nice guy!  Always has a story to share.

 Bads:
1) It's expensive
author: Marc L.

description: Nothing extraordinary, and the staff is rude and closes earlier than advertised.
author: David P.

description: I had never heard of La Canasta before but my wife and I were walking along Union, looking for a bite to eat and it caught our eye.  We knew that it wasn't going to be too expensive and by the line out the door, we knew it was going to be good as well.  It's definitely a hole in the wall but has some character especially with the old woman taking your order.  She reminded me of my grandmother so it was a good start.  We got a burrito, steak quesadilla and carnitas taco.  Everything was very tasty and we'd totally come back if we're in the neighborhood for a quick good meal.
author: Blake B.

description:
Pretty chill that they deliver... food is good, but nothing to write home about. 

However my one complaint would be that i ordered from them on Easter Sunday (online) - it didn't even occur to me that they would be closed as i don't celebrate the holiday. 2 hrs later no food - and they did charge my credit card. Eventually I got reimbursed, but not until after a few weeks of complaining.
author: Alison M.

description:
Terrible! It was a sauna in there I felt so bad for the workers! I ordered to go, 
Food was bland and they didn't have limes for my tacos that i ordered at the register they diddnt bother to tell me they dont have limes untill i picked up my food what kind of mexican place has no frickin limes! grrrr i had to go to the grocery store after, they gave me no chips or salsa plus it was $30.00 for 5 tacos! I will never be back ever!!!!!
author: Deelux D.

description:
Great for drunken fillers but the food is about what you would expect for mexican take out. Their portions are very small and instead of salsa or chopped tomatos they give you a tomato slice... Not sure about you, but i'm not looking for a thin slice of tomato in my ensalada. 

Seeing as there is a serious lack of quick good food on Union, La Canasta isn't a terrible choice but if a business with even decent food were to step in like a chipotle or Pluto's, they'd make a killing.
author: Whitney F.

description:
Totally mediocre.

I hate to write a bad review for a Mexican restaurant.....especially one that delivers!.....but when you live in San Francisco where there is delicious Mexican food around nearly every corner.....it is very disappointing and surprising to get a bad burrito.  And my burrito was bad.

Everything was super salty but without much flavor and the burrito was mostly rice.  They told us on the phone 30 minutes for delivery and our food came in an hour, was not hot, and we paid $30 for a small amount of food.  

Meh.
author: Katy K.

description:
Been eating here off and on for 20+ years and it's always been the best burrito in SF.

Why?

1. The meat is freshly grilled per order over open flame.

The carne asada is simply awesome, way better than the "cook in a 20lb batch, chop to bits, and let sit forever in a steam table until the next batch" system of every other place.

2. The salsa, guacamole and the hot sauce have interesting flavors I've not experienced before, and they form a flavorific synergy.

3. When I ask for a HOT burrito, they can deliver.

Most every place's hot sauce is a joke, but they have habanero sauce such that my burrito can be burning lips, "gimme the milk now!", warm esophagus, warm intestines, and then the next day, fire in the hole.

Other places that rely on Serranos or Jalapenos for heat never achieve that warm, lingering, mouth-filling heat, and have to use so much of those blandly flavored chilis that the pico de gallo suffers, as does mouth feel. Too much quick concentrated heat that overpowers the flavors of the food.

Here's what I always order if you'd like to try it: Regular grilled steak burrito with guacamole, hot sauce and a bit of habanero. The super adds cheese and sour cream, neither of which adds anything. Both are bland and dilute flavor, the cheese a bit sour.


The low ratings here surprise me, everyone I've brought here has thought it awesome, but it seems the bad reviews often mention delivery. I always drop by myself, I want the freshest meal possible. Maybe they are not great for delivery, I dunno.
author: Rob C.

description:
We've decided that after we hit the pullup bars down on the marina front that we should start walking to get our food considering the overflow of donuts into our lives as of recent. It's time to actually walk off some of our food, so I can then begin to consume dinner relatively guilt-free.

But I don't feel guilty when I get my mexican food fix at La Canasta. After the ridiculously accomodating staff takes my high maintenance burrito order (no rice, no sourcream, extra beans, extra cheese,ect ect) I eat in peace at home. The homemade salsa is fresh, flavorful, chunky and spicy. It stands alone, which you can't always say for salsa. Their veggies are fresh, their meat tender and not overcooked, and no lard, no crappy ingredients. Fresh, delicious, relatively healthy mexican food (if you consider burritos healthy like me) and right in the marina hood.

And by the way, the kitchen is CLEAN. I was impressed, and the ladies working that evening were meticulous about food placement, burrito creation, and packing your messy to go order, so that it didn't get all over your pants in the car, or drip down your leg while walking with the order. 

No real wait, as it's a togo only place, so you can call it in and hike to go get it. You can start to work off whatever you are about to eat, while gazing across the street kitty corner at Lululemon wondering when you'll be able to get back into those size 4 exercise pants that now give you "muffin top". Yep, everyone has one of those days. Just admit it.
author: Danielle S.

description: This place is incredible. The family who owns it is so kind and welcoming. I eat here about 2-4 times a week, can't get enough! Have had multiple things off the menu and I have never had a single complaint.
author: Tessa B.

description: Why did I try this place again? Yet again 1.5 hours for delivery when it was supposed to be 40 min. This place is seriously mismanaged.
author: TE C.

description:
Disclaimer: I only had the California tacos and the tortilla soup, I haven't tried the burritos.

I hope the burritos and tamales are good, because the California tacos really sucked. I was expecting the semi-fried tortillas that are kind of crispy but pliable, like you get in central and southern California, but instead I got those tortilla-chip crispy, u-shaped jobs like you can buy in the supermarket. That was probably the biggest issue. But the shredded beef was also dry, and they didn't come with guacamole like it said they were supposed to on the menu. Not inedible or terrible, but totally mediocre. Nick's Crispy even has better tacos than this.

I also had the tortilla soup, and it was... literally tortilla soup. As in, almost nothing but tortillas and broth, with a miniscule amount of cilantro and a sprinkle of cheese. Suuuuper bland. 

I like the fact that they deliver. That's pretty much it.
author: FilmDrunk O.

description: Alberto is wonderful!!  I work at a business down the street and there was a small issue with payment on one of the deliveries that I ordered.  Alberto made it right and gave me a discount on my next order!  He is always so friendly and the burritos are SO YUMMY :)
author: Danielle D.

description:
The food is not bad, it was just not as good as Mission Mexican Food.  I did not expect much better for food in the Marina...

I ordered ahead and the food was ready for me to go.  Just nothing special with it.  It was hot and the order was prepared accurately.  Not a huge rush, but was a little slow on checking out.  

I have not been back.
author: Matthew F.

description:
My girlfriend and I ate here tonight with these results: a rock in my burrito, and she threw up...seriously!   A few elderly mexican ladies used an authentic microwave to cook our food.  What a joke!...and it's a rip off!

Reading five star reviews of this establishment makes me think either relatives are writing, or you routinely attain your meals via dumpster diving.  

LA CANASTA IS LA DUMP!!
author: m m.

description:
Dayam. I went here cause I was in the neighborhood and I didn't know what to eat. I had a few dollars on me, so I needed something quick to fuel me, but I wasn't down for something bad for the arteries. La Canasta showed up like a quick solution for my dilemma.
Before I walked in, I had a feeling it was gonna be good because of the number of people hanging around outside. I walk in and the elder gentleman behind the counter takes his time taking my order as he is focusing on his customer before me. I respect that. So he greets me with a big smile and I am immediately feeling a "grandparent" feeling from him. I like him. I order a camerones taco, a shrimp taco, extra hot. He smiles when I tell him extra hot.
I wait for my order with my elbows on the counter watching the two ladies preparing other orders before mine. As I watch them, I observe how they delicately prepare the food, not rushing like I've seen other small places like this rush to keep up with the customers. It's like they have their own small world behind the counter, respecting the food they prepare. I watch the gentleman behind the counter carefully bagging up the boxes and I can't help but feel that the people here not only run a business, but respect the food the business depends on, despite the crazy rush of people coming in. I sort of panic because I'm just wondering when my inky dink taco is gonna get bagged. No worries, grandpa takes care of it right away. Though he wasn't paying attention to me, he remembered me and bagged my order and gave it to me while still talking to the people waiting for their stuff. I have to give this place props because their service was absolutely classy.
The food. My order. Heaven. That "inky dink" taco I waited for was definitely not inky dink in taste or in size. The salsa that was made was so fresh, you can taste all the flavors come together. They didn't skimp on the shrimp either. Every bite had shrimp in it. Gotta give it to them. Each and every bite I took of that taco reminded me of the care those ladies put into it. MMMMM... Delectable heaven.
author: Sharon B.

description: La Canasta is great Mexican food! If you're not in the Mission neighborhood and you're looking for great Mexican food this place is great. The owner Alberto is a sweetheart too. In all the times we've ordered from here we've never been disappointed.
author: P P.

description:
What a range of reviews. Someone who complains that the owner's English is poor, and doesn't use an upper case "E" is not trustworthy. Alberto speaks impeccably, and Lily, a stunning & refined lady, speaks just as well, but with a bit more accent.

To the guy who commented that La Canasta doesn't compare with the Mission? Perhaps he needs to consider that Mexico is a huge country, and has regional dialects and foods, just as we do in the United States.  The owners come from Puebla, a  highlands region south of Mexico City. The food is lighter.  To further illustrate, consider New York versus Chicago style pizza. Both species are available in San Francisco. Then go to Italy, and order pizza from a small outdoor cafe in a hidden piazza. Now you have some experience upon which to draw a good comparative study. 

To most people in California, "Mexican Food" means food from Northern Baja.  It's heavier, greasier and cow-centric. La Canasta is not for you if you have Baja in mind. That is not their fault.  Don't bash them because you haven't bothered to learn culinary dialects.

La Canasta is special to those of us who live in Cow Hollow-Marina-Pac Hts.  Fresh, wholesome and made to order. No lard. Food made with love that fills stomach and soul.  My first choice always. Good value for the price and you needn't feel guilty feeding their food to your kids.

Lily and Alberto are two of the kindest  people in Cow Hollow. When my eldest son was a  baby,  Lily would grab him, and send me out for a walk. I needed that!  She sat him on her hip and fed him guacamole by the spoonful!   Both boys are grown and healthy; must have been all that vitamin A!

One more thing.  Waiting for something sure is a pain.  But we all have to expect that we will find ourselves waiting for something or someone, right?  (Say, nine months for a baby.  Or waiting for that baby to, albeit a bit mournfully, to grow from  toddler into a Little Gator and looking outward now. Or waiting for your son to come home from his first semester at university?)  Relax. Think of waiting for your burrito as stolen time to just slow down for a few minutes. It's worth it.
author: Chris J.

description: Very nice ppl. I had regular grilled steak burrito with guacamole and medium sauce. Perfection! Would go back again although I wish the price was a little lower.
author: Tyrone C.

description:
Quick and dirty, like my dates.

Right around the coner from me.  
They Deliver! (Ole!)
Reasonably priced...for the Marina. (I give it two hand carried chihahuas out of five)
But expect to wait (Dios Mio - Mexican for OMG, idiot, learn a language)

Not my favorite, not my least favorite...right down the middle of the fairway.
author: Mark C.

description:
how much do I love this place?...MUCHO! It's the real-deal and has been around since the 1950s. LaCanasta is to taquerias like Lucca Delicatessen is to Italian delis.

Spotless clean!
Great, fresh HOMEMADE food
They use Canola oil instead of the greasy heart-stopping, artery clogging alternative....not that you'll lose weight by eating here...

The gentleman who runs the place has endeared himself to me forever by remembering me (or at least he acted like he remembered me) after the 3rd visit. That's old-school and I like it!

Simple,  homemade, friendly, chips, salsa, and great guac. perfie!
author: Jennifer B.

description: I've been going to La Canasta for years, and still love it. Everything is made fresh to order, so calling ahead can sometimes save some time. The food is great and the staff very friendly. I highly recommend La Canasta!
author: Mary W.

description: Best authentic Mexican food around. Super cheap and the owners could not be sweeter people.
author: Griffin H.

description:
La Canasta has been my go to neighborhood spot for Mexican take-out for years. The food is consistently good and inexpensive. Plus, I like supporting a local Mom-&-Pop shop. The owners are very nice - although abuela can be grumpy, especially if you talk to her in English. But what the heck, it adds a certain charm and authenticity to the taqueria experience. My favorite items to order here are the shredded beef enchiladas verde and the "regular" carnitas burrito + guacamole. 

For all of the "bland" food haterade drinkers - just ask for the "spicy" salsa next time you order. Calling ahead will definitely expedite your check out process, which is extra helpful if you double park out front. Cuatro estrellas!
author: Rebecca O.

description: This is a great Mexican food TO-GO place. Remember that. I have been going there since it originally opened on Filbert Street. My wife and I would stop there at least once a week for their fresh and inexpensive food. Of course, being a guy, I would order the largest super carnitas or pastor burrito. My wife would order more sensible items along with their homemade drinks. We'd head of to Marina Greens or other parks and have a picnic. I used to own several businesses in the area and came to know of La Canasta (known to the locals as Canastas) from my employees. They would show up at work with delicious looking Mexican food, I had to find out where. I did and now, it is my place of choice in the  northern part of the city. Love it.
author: George C.

description:
Burrito in the wall....
great tiny place for food to go. My office is in the corner and I like to support local restaurants/food place.
probably the best bank for the bucks in the Marina.
Alberto is the nicest guy and he always include some of his special extra mas picante sauce.
if it is not picante it is not mexican food...

Who said you had to spend a lot of money for some good food?

I need to open a small hle in the wall mexican resaturant in France. We do not have authentic burritos and something tells me it would work. Maybe half a burrito on a bed of lettuce with a couple of escargots...Love it already.

For the burritos without the snails , go see Alberto
author: Thierry H.

description:
I've ordered some chile verde and chili con carne for delivery yesterday, it was soooooo good.
Food came in fast and it tasted so fresh and yummy, just wonderful.
I'm definitely keeping this phone number for future orders, definitely worth it!
author: Paula L.

description: I was very disappointed.  I  was really excited to find a Mexican place that delivered.  However, the carnitas burrito was dry and too salty; could only eat 1/3.  The carne asada was dry and flavorless, though less salty.  The tamale was inedible.  The masa was like rubber and this weird texture.
author: Dee H.

description: So my friend and I were in the neigborhood and there was a scoutmob deal. I went and ordered the cheese empanada and carne asada taco. My friend got the burrito. I thought the cheese empanada was only one piece, but it came with 3 in the box along with guacamole and salsa. The skin of the empanada was really thick and not enough cheese. The taco was pretty good, not the best. Others are right about the wait time though, make sure you're not in a rush when you order. We waited about 20 minutes for our food and there were only 3 people in front of us.
author: Stephanie Y.

description: I love la canasta! Alberto and staff are very friendly and make delicious mole enchiladas! I recommend to try it!
author: Lisa F.

description:
We're enjoying some half-time food from La Canasta

Taco nice and crispy. 
Burrito tortilla grilled a bit. 

Would have given 5 stars but they used a little more styrophom packaging than they needed.
author: Joshua E.

description:
Sabroso!!!  Love the mom & pop mexican joint in the marina.  prices are totally reasonable... hence, the single "$" in the profile.  I just went with the fajita burrito with carne asada y refried beans, no crema.  deeeeee-vine!!!

and a quesadilla appetizers for $3.50 for those that are truly hungry.  not a better deal in this neighborhood.

But I most psyched that La Cansta made a commitment to being green.  I can use my Viv sticker here (http://www.doyouviv.com) and as the Viv transactions add up, they become a more sustainable operation.  Schweet!!
author: Kevin F.

description: Ordered delivery and it arrived within the promised time however the food was so soggy I had to throw it out.  The nachos didn't seem to have any cheese on them and I even ordered extra cheese.  I'm still not sure how the food can be that soggy!!!  Maybe this place is not a good fit for delivery.  The salsa was good though.
author: Lisa K.

description: I ordered online using Seamless.com and I called to confirm that had my received my order (it said that they would email my confirmation, but they failed to do so). The woman answered, said they got my order, but then NEVER DELIVERED! And they never answered my phone call to check back an hour later (they said 35-45 mins).
author: Stephanizzle P.

description:
Service and Simplicity.  This is what these folks are about...

I started buying burritos, tacos, platos and soup here years ago - I can't count how many years.  And for years, these folks have their regulars double-parked outside to get their tasty goodness.

I'm concerned about what many folks are saying about the chicken being bland - it seems to be an issue with that dish perhaps? - and perhaps they can change this down the line.

But the big pluses are...

1.  Tortilla Soup.  Zingy, rich broth with a hint (just a hint) of clove... beautiful

2.  Cochinita anything.  I suggest those folks who are feeling "blanded" head on over to the cochinita - marinated pork that is out of this world... they do it in tacos and tortas etc.

3.  Chile Verde etc.  Again, anybody worried about bland chicken might try pork.  Their platos are large and probably the best value here.

4.  Guacamole.  Always fresh and tasty.

5.  SERVICE.  The gentleman owner is a star of gracious hospitality, yes.  His wife is very professional and perhaps not as strong in English.  

If your food is dry or bland, why not tell the super-nice man at the counter?  I'm sure if he heard from enough polite Yelpers he might  tweak the recipe on that chicken, for example...

I know he has a young son as well as extended family and he's The Man at the counter so - he may not read Yelp daily.  Since he speaks English beautifully and likes to chat with customers - tell him what's on your mind!

I'm a fan - of the food AND the people.
author: Juliana C.

description: Came here for lunch the other day and got the enchiladas with red sauce. Very good quality with reasonable prices. The owner is super friendly as well, and look forward to trying more of the menu-
author: John L.

description: I've had a lot of Mexican food and this is by far the best quality and quantity for your money. Amazing food and even better service! 5 stars!
author: Vaughn L.

description:
WARNING: Do not eat here. Incredibly unsanitary. The mere thought of this place makes me queasy...
I used to work next door to La Canasta. We shared a teensy bathroom. This bathroom doubled as their washroom.
Yes. They washed all their dishes in the bathroom sink. The same one everyone washed their pee hands in. And since the sink would get stopped up with beans, the gross pee water builds up and just sits in there with the dishes that they're cooking your food with.
Not to mention that their food blows chunks. I repeat - do not eat here.
author: Taylor E.

description:
Tomorrow the Hubby goes back to work which is so great in so many ways but sucks in one major way. We work opposite schedules and have a toddler, so our time together will be next to nothing and our time alone will be practically non-existent. 

So he picked me up from work, the kid in the back seat with a promise of frozen yogurt. We really wanted ice cream, but due to having a baby my cholesterol is a bit high and he is trying to help me get it back to normal. So off we went to seek out frozen yogurt and we did.

After dessert we realized that we needed to figure out what we were going to eat for dinner. Being in the marina we tried to think of something quick, easy, and good? It is hard to find something to bring home that satisfies those categories in the marina. 

Then we thought of this take out Mexican restaurant that we have always been curious about but have never tried. It looks so promising!  There is just a counter and a plastic bench outside. Little old ladies behind the counter give you the false sense of security that the food is truly going to be authentically delicious.
