(I don't know why, if they weren't good cooks when they were young then they won't be much better now!) The menu is small but sounds promising, with all the staples of a good taqueria including home fried tortilla chips, both corn and flour. We didn't try those but they did look delicious.    

The hubby stuck with the classic carnitas burrito. It was okay, but nothing inspired. I wouldn't go back for it. I got a half order of a platos de carne. I got the chile Colorado. It came with rice, re-fried beans coated with melted cheese, corn tortillas, and the Chile Colorado. It was really not that good. So disappointing! Anyways, lesson learned. Not horrible, but is that any reason to go back?
author: Esa Y.

description: Ordered delivery thru Eat24hours.com - estimated delivery was 45-60 minutes - actually delivery time was 1 hour and 30 mins. Other than that the food was great! Very fresh & wonderful Carnitas plate! Great salsa and guacamole, can't say the same thing about the refried pinto beans (yuck! no flavor and I love beans!), overall 4 stars!
author: Cary Elizabeth L.

description:
Um, today sucked here. 

I am on a diet - the "Jessica Diet" thus my rules apply - so I got a CHICKEN burrito (not my usual MEAT) and no sour cream. IT SUCKED.

The chicken had no flavor. I got one giant piece of avocado in the middle and Avocado SHELL. YUCK YUCK. 

Also, I had to wait forever to order bc the cute old man was talking to Spanish to the customer in front of me. UM HELLO, can I order and THEN you finish your convo?!!
author: Jessica L.

description: The Food was bad and the service was worse. No meat in the enchiladas, almost no cheese. All the food was delivered cold. They said 40 minutes for delivery and it took 1 hr. and 10 min. And then they shorted me part of my order. After 4 hours of waiting they still didn't bring the rest of my order or refund the money they cheated me out of. BEWARE!!!!
author: Mitchell R.

description:
Sometime between my junior and senior year of college, a Taco Bell magically appeared in Morris County, NJ.  Some of my buddies and I had heard of these mythical places.  They served something called...burritos.  We wondered what burritos were.   What were these strange things from the land beyond Tejas, Arizona, and California.  (Diversity where I grew up and attended school meant you didn't celebrate Columbus Day or St. Patrick's Day.)  We began wolfing these strange and wonderful foodstuffs down.  Better yet, they were open late.  For the first time in my life I was confronted with what the hell "refried" meant.  (As Mitch Hedberg once said, "I like refried beans, but maybe fried beans are just as good and we're just wasting time.)

Flash forward to the summer of '99 and my arrival in the Golden State.  I learned a new lesson.  Taco Bell sucked.  You could go elsewhere for the magical burrito.  And there were lots of places to buy them.  Wow.  I can get fat at a variety of establishments.  Wonderful.  I then learned that the best place to get burritos was in the Mission.  However, whenever I ventured into the Mission I got dirty looks from people.  These people wore black, had pierced parts of their bodies that I did not know could be pierced, and seemed to hate clothing that has either a collar or buttons...or heaven forbid....BOTH.  I was told that these are hipsters.  They are cooler than you, hate your madras shorts and collared shirts, and don't want you in the Mission.

That's where La Canasta saved me.  This is exactly the kind of Mexican take out joint that prevails in the Mission.  Except there aren't a line of pretentious hipsters inside giving you dirty looks because own a razor and wash on a regular basis.  Most importantly it is in a great location and I can walk down the hill to get there.  

The portions are awesome.  Sometimes too big to finish.  (Who am I kidding...I always finish their burritos.  Just ask my tailor.)  The ingredients are in good proportion to one another.  The shrimp burrito is excellent.  Probably because they put more than two of those little critters in there.  I wish they gave you some complimentary chips, but then my tailor would be apoplectic.  (I can't take out these pants anymore!!!  Lose some weight instead!)  

My only complaints are that I wish they stayed open a little later and were a little speedier.  The ordering area is a little tight as well.  Another reason to pass on the chips.  I might not fit in there otherwise.
author: Chris I.

description: The garden vegetable burrito is humorously bad. It literally seemed like they defrosted a bag of frozen veggies, threw in some salsa, and put it in a wrap. You'd think in a city with amazing produce, "garden vegetable" burritos would have...well, GARDEN vegetables.
author: Sarah B.

description:
This little stop of authentic latin food is GREAT! ! ! I truely love this little shack and how the kitchen is open so you can see what preperation goes into the making of a great colorado burritto or great chicken tacos. 
I was low on cash shopping on Union St. with a friend and we stumbled apon this place. 
I definatley would recommend anyone to this place. 
Its truely an experience there becasue the Service ( 2 old ladies) behind the counter speak spanish but its fun and undersandable. 
To this i say Adios amigos! 
--ranndy
author: Randy J.

description: Carnitas are always dry.  Also I always end up with large chunks of meat in the burritos.  One bite is all rice, the next is all sour cream, the next is a giant chunk of meat.  Since Tacko opened up 2 blocks away, I haven't been back
author: Jesse K.

description:
It was okay overall.  Black beans aren't too hard to get right, the rice was okay...the problem was the tortilla...it wasn't steamed.  There was too much flour on it and it wasn't warm enough to be able to expand...so it was so so. 

The people working were very nice and quick.  I don't hate it...I'll say that much.
author: Jess S.

description:
As a rule, I generally don't hit Taqeruia's outside my neighborhood, because it's usually just wrong.  And a perfect example is this place that might be mistaken for a card game.  Smack dab in the middle of Cow Hollow, I only went here because my friend who works down the street was hungry for their tostadas.

I don't see how such a tiny place that is so small, it rivals some walk i closets.  No seating at all, and barely any standing room for lining up to order.  It was fun to see the 4 cooks stepping over each other trying to get all the orders filled.  Each item is cooked to order, so expect to wait.

Anyway, I tried the Quesidilla suiza and it was just OK.  But they do come with sour creme and guacamole.  I also ordered some "California" tacos, which are hard shell tacos, with your choice of beef or chicken.  They come with lettuce, salsa and cheese, but a bit expensive at $2.50 each.  The tostada was OK, and my friend takes a spin on it my making it into a sort of taco salad.  She liked it, but I was not impressed.  We tried the chimichanga, but again, we were not impressed.  It was small, and not very interesting.

I found the food to be uninspiring, run of the mill, taqueria.  If you live in the area, then maybe this place is for you.  But they did give me a big batch of chips and salsa, which they normally charge for.  Also note it's not wheelchair accesible.

SEE?  An acutal "New Review"!
author: Michael M.

description:
Truth be know, this is the best of its kind. Everything is made from scratch with high quality ingredients. The food is fresh and clean and "authenitic" if one can make such a claim. 

Enter on Buchanan and up the little stairs to be greeted with a warm welcome and a smile from the extraordinarily gracious and friendly owner, Alberto. This is the kind of place that specializes in making you feel at home.

You can watch your meats being grilled to order and a pot of beans or stewed beef in tomato sauce simmering with love! Everything is tailored to your preference and when you return a few times, they always remember you and how you like it.

What to try?  Anything and everything! 

I've tried those Mission Taquerias that everyone is raving about, but I assure you, if you care about quality, freshness and your health, eat here!
author: Fareed R.

description:
I  have this and the Balboa on my speed-dial, for the same reason that the owner's could be my surrogate parents for all the wonderful dishes they serve me whenever I stop by! 

I'm not Mexican, obviously, but I come in second best for all of the charm we kindred spirit's share - Try anything fajita based or the enchilada's and get a Mexican coke too!
author: Yelper A.

description:
Vegetarian soft tacos with black beans - that's what I'm talking about! 

The other stuff is fine, but nothing special.  Great neighborhood spot for casual take out.
author: Xaman E.

description: Excellent food, affordable price, and they even wrapped my burrito in corn tortillas to make it gluten-free!
author: Stephanie D.

description: All I have to say is wonderful food!! The older gentleman , possibly the owner is awesome!! Such a sweet man!!
author: No Need T.

description:
If you can't make the trek to the Mission, or to Mexico for that matter, check this hole-in-the-wall out. Spot on mexican fare. 

 I can't count the number of tacos and burritos I consumed from here in the two years I lived down the street, but I was never disappointed and argue that this is one of the best burrito joints in the city.  

No frills. Good prices. Just make sure you confirm what your ordered, especially if you call ahead, since the mother tongue here is not the King's English.
author: Ben S.

description: I think San Franciscans take this place for granted! Being from LA, Mexican food is essential down here. My boyfriend decided to search for some places in the area and he fell in love with this little place because it's family owned and reminded him of his grandfathers restaurant back home. Yes, this place is a hole in the wall but those are the best places! There isn't enough room for tables and chairs (that's how small it is) but there are a few benches to sit on outside. The owner is very personable and even remembered my boyfriends name! They had a very nice chat. We ordered two burritos to go and they were awesome! He even gave us chips and salsa and we saved it for a snack later in the day. I give this place 5 stars, 6 if it was possible because this place is authentic Mexican food and it is awesome!
author: Gabbie S.

description:
Man, this was some yummy comidas! I had a carne asada burrito "grande" with some cholula it was magnifico. It was EXACTLY what i wanted and was worth the 9 bucks it cost. This place is close, the guy was nice and gave me what i wanted (mas queso por favor, senor!) 

One funny thing- they have a margarita poster/ad outside.....but they are "to take out" only and don't sell alky.....hehe...blame it on the aaaassada! (sorry, i know a little dorky)
author: Jess V.

description:
What a shining light in the fetid shit hole that is Cow Hollow (offense fully intended) for cheap and nourishing food.

Yes, the food is "bland" if you compare it to anywheres else.  But pull your head out and look around you dude...Does this neighborhood look unbland to you?  Just be thankful that you can get a good warm meal for seven bucks in this nouveau riche whore-festival.  How's steak fajitas at Bus Stop suit you?

The food tastes like what I'd imagine my Mexican-American grandma would be making me while working here and she rocks!  If you'd prefer your taqueria's manned by her sons, you'd have to get outa that area of town.  They still work at many other eateries here though.

The carne asada items are grilled when you place your order so it has just tasted the tongues of flame just prior to tasting yours.  I think the fact that there is always a wait there for lunch-hour tells you that both the place is too small to serve you as quickly, and that the food is good enough for people to keep coming back.  Or maybe they've looked around, and chose this place over their neighbors.  People that have to work in this neighborhood often eat here.  You can tell by the number of cleaning/utilities and delivery service vehicles often double parked while they're waiting for theirs.  Place your order, go run some walkable errands, then come back to pick it up.  It's as simple as that.
author: Bruce L.

description:
Granted, I had Gordo's for breakfast, but this place is disappointing. I wish there was a way to get those 16 cubic inches of stomach space back. My grilled chicken burrito tasted like wet cotton balls. I actually had to put tomato sauce and salt on it when I got home to feel like I was eating actual food. It literally tasted like heavy air. 

I will give them 2 stars given that the little old guy behind the counter was super nice and the chicken was high quality. 

By the way, Bruce L (below), you are an freakin idiot. It's really annoying when people use Yelp as a forum to hate on other neighborhoods. I'm sure you live in the Mission and grew up in Marin but don't let your bicycle delivery friends know that. Seriously... did someone drag you to Cow Hollow? Go home. 

Oh yeah, and the carnitas plate is supposed to be bomb. I'd probably give that a chance if I were stuck without a ride to Gordos.
author: Michael D.

description:
La CoNASTY,
as it is better known, simply doesn't compare to Gordos (inner sunset, 9th Ave) or Mexico Au Park (South Park, SOMA, Second St).  

There were bones in the pork and tendon in the chicken.  
Saving Grace= the large, Mexican women who prepare the food, and love to spit insults (in Spanish) to one another about the Cow Hollow/Marina customers.  One cannot entirely blame them in some circumstances.
author: William HARRISON W.

description: Absolutely the best authentic Mexican food in San Francisco. Lily and Alberto, the owners, are two of the nicest people I have ever come across - either one of them is always there. They make all of the food in house - yes, that includes the Chile Colarado and Tomales (time consuming!!!). The only downside is that the place is only to-go; no seating. Regardless, give it a shot - you will be rewarded with excellent service and excellent food!!!
author: Donald C.

description:
I can't believe I've lived two blocks down from this place for close to two and a half years and never tried it until yesterday! I had a friend in town for the day and we were craving Mexican food but didn't want to sit in a restaurant. I remembered seeing this place time and time again walking around the hood and thought it was time to finally try it.

My hesitation was always that La Canasta was claiming to have "Authentic Mexican food," but resided in Cow Hollow....I mean how good could it be? It just didn't make sense...call me ignorant but eating authentic Mexican food in Cow Hollow just seemed like an oxymoron. I'm excited to say that I was very pleased with the quality of food here.

I ordered a grande carnitas burrito. It came with the works: pork, beans, rice, cheese, guacamole, salsa and I held the sour cream. Overall, it did the trick. I've had burritos that had more tender pork but it was still damn good considering. I'll definitely be meandering over often now that I know it's tasty - how convenient!
author: Julia N.

description: Came here to use a scoutmob 50% off. The old woman who apparently is the wife to the owner was rude and acted as if she had never so much as heard the word "coupon". I fault a huge language barrier as she seemed to have no clue what we wanted and what the deal meant. (Don't offer a deal if your employees do not understand.) Initially she was not even going to honor the deal - we just wanted guacamole. After about 20 minutes, she gave in and gave us the deal. However, being that she was so mad about it, she then insisted that an 8 dollar order of guacamole did not come with chips. Really?! It was absurd and she was just trying to win the battle. The other employees looked at her like she was crazy and quickly shoved some chips in our bag and said thank you. I don't think I would come here again even if I had a coupon that paid me to go there.
author: Brian N.

description:
I finally had a chance to order some food from this place since every time I wander by, it is closed. Take note that they close around 9pm. 

Food: The food was uninspiring and I have to concur with other reviewers that it was bland as well. 

Atmosphere: It is a tight squeeze in here to get to the register to place an order and wait for your food. While I was waiting for my food to be made, surprisingly many customers crowded the small space, getting my hopes up that I finally found a great little Mexican place in my own neighborhood.

Service: The people who run this place were friendly, and the man at the register seemed to know and chat with many regulars. Thumbs up for the service!

Value: Prices were inexpensive for the food. But not a good value because the tasteless food led me to walk home and cook something else.

Overall I was disappointed with this place because I really wanted to find a great mexican place within walking distance of my apartment.
author: Cynthia D.

description: Alberto was great to talk to. Food was absolutely excellent and was ready within 3 minutes of ordering. Come here if you are looking for authentic Mexican food
author: Brian M.

description: Though literally a hole in the wall, this place is the BEST! There are two good Mexican restuarants within a block of me but I walk the 1/2 mile to get their food. My favorites are the beef California tacos and the Chile Verde or Chile Colorado burritos. Take-out only and no standing room at peak times after ordering. Give them try!
author: Ed L.

description:
This place is great, and the food is authentic. 

Beans, rice, meat, tortilla=mexican food. Sure you can dress it up more if you want, but don't say it isn't authentic just because it isn't drenched in sour cream and salsa.

Alberto and his family have always provided me excellent service during the eight years I've been going here. I wouldn't recommend delivery, as it takes too long, but besides that, I have nothing but positives to say about this place.

Service: Excellent. Alberto is extremely polite, and while his wife isn't as charming (hey, who is?), she provides great service too with kindness. The two ladies who make the food work hard and work fast, and I speak strong spanish, and I've never heard them make fun of anyone like other reviewers here have claimed. Paranoid much?

I stick to the basics, cuz I'm cheap. Regular veggie burrito, all day every day, pinto beans, spicy. If I'm feel like gaining weight I'll get the chorizo burrito or adobo tacos. 

I love this place, and you should, too. Sure, it's not as lardtastic as some Mission taquerias, but that's not necessarily a bad thing.
author: Spencer W.

description: This is a hole-in-the-wall takeout-only type place. I swung by today to have some nachos. How much do you think they charge for nachos w/ chicken? I didn't even look at the menu, but I was surprised when the guy rang me up for $9.53. Are you kidding me? $10 for nachos w/ chicken and no drink. Were they huge? Nope - smaller than I expected, actually. Did they taste good? They were fine, I guess. But seriously... $10 for some average nachos with chicken? Weak.
author: Kevin H.

description:
Nice people.  The owner is totally cool.  A little pricey, but hey, it's Cow Hollow, I'm sure his rent ain't Mission cheap.

Really fresh ingredients.  They grill the meat for each order; no mystery pan in a heat tray like virtually every other taqueria in the city.  I've been eating here for years.
author: mitori a.

description:
Lets get the negatives out of the way first:
Chicken used in the dishes is bland.
Bean element is too watery to hold the structual integrity needed for an excellent burrito.

That being said, everything else is delicous and the staff give you generally warm and fuzzy feeling, like your one of his favorite customers, but genuine, not over the top. 

So don't eat the chicken, and maybe sub in some other beans and you are golden. If you want a good authentic mexican meal, go to Mexico, if you want a rather solid burrito, la canasty is the place.
author: Mark B.

description:
All of the Marina t00ls that think the food sucks here probably also think that a burrito needs rice in it, that Uggs are still cool and that jaeger-bombs at the BusStop at 11pm on a Tuesday are cool and that leaving your credit card there to pick up on Friday is 'what Bro's do."

Wait. I think that is it.

p.s. try the carnitas. Move away from the burrito. Seriously.
author: Steven M.

description:
I beg to differ from almost all the reviews posted here. I ordered dinner from La Canasta yesterday (from SeamlessWeb.com. The delivery guy called me at 7pm, exactly per my instructions. But, that was the only positive highlight! 

I requested lettuce, tomatoes, onions guac, sour cream, etc etc on my veggie burrito. And guess what, the $10-burrito came with 8 different small salsa containers, and was extremely dry and stale. The $11 Torta turned out to be worse than a 6" subway sandwich with lettuce and tomatoes.  I think La Canasta delivered the worst Mexican food in my 10 year experience relishing Mexican cusine in the Bay area. 

Minus 10 stars for food quality 
Minus 5 stars for making me walk to the BART station to pick up 
Zero stars for showing up on time
author: Rohit K.

description:
Super huge, fairly tasty burrito's.
Very Mom & Pop, and very reasonably priced for the marina.
One of my fav places in the area - I would come here more if it wasn't such a hike from work.
When wandering union though I almost always stop here, get a burrito, and eat it on a conveniently located curb anywhere nearby to people watch - good times.
author: Chris M.

description:
Somewhat authentic.  That's good.  They let me order in Spanish without laughing at me, that's good.  

Their food is pretty good, but messy.  Probably the most authentic Mexican food in this part of town.  The ladies working here are always really nice.

Why don't I give it more stars?  Because the times I've eaten here I always feel a little sick later.  I'm not sure if that is because the ingredients are so authentic, or because they are so un-authentic, but either way. I don't like that part.
author: Brett J.

description:
I love that I can order a mojado style grilled chicken burrito and watch you put the meat on the grill right then. I also love that you will deliver my burritos to my apartment, along with your wonderful super nachos.

I'm a little concerned by Taylor E's post (8/21/07) that says you wash your dishes in the bathroom sink, though. Is that possible? Can a restaurant exist in SF for so many years and the inspectors never catch that?  Let's take a look:

http://dphwww.sfdph.org/eh/Violations/Loc_CurrentViol.asp?LocationID=4703

True, an 88 rating isn't spectacular. But it's also not horrible. (Nick's got an 86, for example.)  Cantasta, you lose one star for possible pee-hand burritos...  but after enjoying them for 10 years, I can't break up with you just yet.  My hope is that your '08 inspection will show improvement.
author: Jeff T.

description:
I'm leaving the neighborhood soon and am making a tour of my favorites before I do - which, of course, meant a dinner-time stop at La Canasta.

I love that it's family-owned. And that the family doesn't laugh at you when you use your high-school-level (read: very pathetic) Spanish to make your order.

The food is consistently good and a good value. I'd just like it to be a TEENY bit spicier. Though, to be fair, it's probably just for all of us gringos.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Burritos overfilled with beans, guacamole, and beef strips is all it takes for me. Hey, I'm not that picky or complicated when it comes to my food. The place is the only spot on Union that has Mexican food and they makes some gooood burritos! 

The service is always top-notched. The old man is always friendly, never messes up my order, and doesn't easily forget a customer's face! 

Just go. You know you want to.
author: Emily F.

description: My favourite burrito place in SF.  Staff are friendly and polite.  Every "Best of SF" burrito place in the Mission uses tons of lard, which is of course tasty, but turns Mexican food into fast food that's terrible for you, no better than McDonald's.  La Canasta doesn't use lard, things taste fresher, and their food has real flavours that stand by themselves.  La Canasta is in a different class.
author: Reuben S.

description:
I am in love with this place. It is exactly what I most want and crave when I'm looking to eat mexican food.  It's authentic, fresh and home made. It's also simple.
They have the best Chile Relleno I've had in a restaurant.. The pepper is fresh, and roasted, not slimy. Good cheese, amazing sauce - a little herbaceous.
The tortillas soup is so soothing, flavorful, eveything it should be, nothing it shouldn't. Real broth, not empty, salty, canned stuff.
The Vegetariano taco isn't something I would normally order, but I was testing them. They passed. It's a crispy taco with beans, guac, cheese, and salsa. This is a simple dish to make, but so many places would make it gross, theirs is so yummy and craveable. Not greasy at all.

I can't wait to eat here again.
author: Janeen B.

description:
This is a great super-easy, relatively quick, authentic mexican shop that is only 5 mins from my house. They're friendly and patient if I try and remember my Spanish. The food is good, fresh, and I've never been sick here (unlike I just was in Houston today when I had Mexican food here). 

Let's just go by the motto today of  "Californians do it better". 

I miss you SF. Like, really. Is it Thursday yet?
author: Sally M.

description: I write this on behalf of my husband.   He went there religiously numerous times a week for their vegetarian burrito for about 10 years.  I personally think their gaucamole leaves much to be desired - but they have the warmest staff and great service.  Oh and perfectly salted tortilla chips.  There isn't seating here - so you need to take your food to go.
author: Madhuri K.

description:
I work in the neighborhood, and this is the only decent place on Union St (actually, it's the only place on Union Street) for Mexican food. I could walk to Chestnut, but dealing with Marina folk tires me out too much. That, and I'm lazy.

I usually switch between burritos, tacos, or the chicken tortilla soup. All the meat is really good, but I usually get the carnitas (good thing my boyfriend isn't kosher). My co-worker gets the enchiladas all the time, but I wasn't that impressed with them.

Let me just say something about the soup: it was really, really weird at first. The broth is red, which I was not expecting. The first sip has a tomato-y taste. I thought, 'Great. Thanks, coworkers. This shit sucks.' But then, the next thing I knew, it was five days in a row later of chicken tortilla soup for lunch. The tortillas in the soup are THE BEST I've ever had. They're not stringy or gargantuan strips of tortilla chips...they're just the perfect size so that you can eat them in one bite, and so that they end up just the right amount of soggy by the time you eat your soup.

Also worth mentioning is their guacamole, salsas, and Mexican wedding cakes.

I always spend no more than $6-7 (because I always tip them at least $1), and end up really full.

I love the owner (the old man). He's so friendly; I want to adopt him as my Abuelo. (I'm not Mexican). He always remembers things we talked about last time. His wife is not as friendly, but I presume this is because her English is not that great. I should mention though that almost every time she helps me, my order gets a little tweaked or takes longer than it should. (I think she works the later shift).

It is a REALLY small space. My bathroom is bigger than this place. Sometimes it's hard to figure out who's waiting for food, and who's waiting to order. They have a makeshift wrap-around bench outside, and there are two other benches, though I'm not sure if they belong to Canasta or Jamba (it's right next door). I would hardly consider that outside seating, since anything as messy as a burrito or taco shouldn't really be eaten over your lap.

I never think about what goes on behind the scenes in a restaurant; if washing dishes in the bathroom sink is what you're worried about, you probably just shouldn't eat out (I can attest to the many entries about the [un]sanitary levels in restaurants, having worked in many dining establishments before). I once worked at a restaurant where we served a bagel that had fallen onto the floor to a SIX YEAR OLD GIRL. 

But the two big cons: the size and sanitary issue...aren't these part of the charm of hole-in-the-wall ethnic eateries anyway?
author: Sachi T.

description:
The food is fresh.  Too fresh.  Could use more sauce and flavor....  But it's cheap!   $3.80 for a big vegetarian burrito!

(Personally, I'd walk down to Andale on Chestnut.)
author: Melanie C.

description: This place is TERRIBLE! The food is just OK and the delivery and customer service...dont get me started!!! Apparently it takes the driver 35 minutes to deliver an order and by the time my food got here, it might have well have come from the North Pole because it was so rancidly cold  mushy. I ordered Nachos and Chimichungas. When they FINALLY got here, the Nachos were so soggy and wet it looked like puke and the Chimichunga tasted like it had been sitting out for hours (which it kinda had because it took the delivery guy a 35 mins to get here). Next time I'm in the mood for a little Mexican, I'm totally gong to Pancho Villas on Polk and Clay. Viva Pancho Villas!
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
I had a fairly underwhelming burrito here, but the price is right and they're friendly (except when ignoring you for phone orders...see below).

I think the best way to go is to call ahead.  The phone never seems to stop ringing, and it's a little obnoxious when you're standing there and the guy behind the counter takes phone calls instead of your order (this happened each time I went).  Not that I'd expect white-glove service while patronizing a burrito place, but flat-out ignoring your customers is rude.  Rule of thumb is that if someone is standing in your restaurant, you serve, or at least acknowledge them over a phone order.

And sorry, but 8:53pm is NOT 9pm (when they close).  You left me hungry La Canasta.
author: Nate H.

description:
Simple, delicious Mexican fare at a very decent price, especially for the neighborhood.  The owner always greets me with a smile and a hello, and thanks me warmly on the way out.  They ALWAYS get my typically picky order right, and I usually get two meals out of a burrito (around $6 for a veggie, $7-9 for meat).

I wish there were some less pricey options for other stuff, but I am not complaining!  I always feel good giving my business to this place.
author: Jenny S.

description:
Great Mexican food that delivers!!!! 
If you're looking for customer service, DONT GO HERE...If you're looking for great Mexican food in the neighborhood???? GO HERE! 
Everything from the empinadas to the burritos.
author: Jarrod R.

description:
For a place right off Union St, the food is pretty authentic.  The place is clean, the food is quick, and the arbol sauce is damn good.

There's something funky; however, in the burritos and I haven't placed it yet - maybe there's garlic powder in the guac.  I'm not really sure but I've been going sans guac lately.

If you want their best, get a plate lunch (or dinner, whatever) with the meat, beans and rice separate.  Tortillas on the side...some assembly required...and pony up some change for a side of the arbol sauce.

Auf.
author: Dave K.

description: must've been an off day (but in my many years in the marina and my many ill give it just one more chance cause its inexpensive and its quick)... there will be no more chances. The staff was rude. Not a single hello, smile, nothing when they finally took my order. Had to wait for ten minutes while they argued with each other. My burrito was one of the worst I ever had, the shell was the only thing that was heated and it was loosely made with too wet beans cracking out on most sides. The rice was cold and hard and crunchy and  the cheese was cold and clumpy. It was barely edible. in a city of fantastic food I wouldn't bother
author: Nikii B.

description:
It's no Nick's Crispy, but it does the job.  

Avoid the soupy, unseasoned burritos and instead rely on the solid, seemingly healthful fajitas platters.  A half-size order does the job -- grilled chicken or steak, a side of guac, salsa, and pinto beans with melty cheese on top -- plus your choice of corn or flour tortillas.  Good enough.
author: Ann M.

description:
I recently moved to SF from San Diego so I guess I'm a little spoiled in terms of taco shops.  When I think of a carne asada burrito I picture a burrito stuffed full of well seasoned carne, a little cheese, a little guac and some salsa on the side for about $4-$5.....and open 24 hours

La Canasta= small burrito, poorly wrapped, hardly any carne and the worst of all, it was $9.75!!!
The 2 ladies working there on a sat afternoon were unbelievably rude!! I understood everything they were saying in Spanish, they cussed and complained when I asked for extra salsa and were extremely rude from the second I walked in.  

I live a block away and want nothing more than a good local taco shop, but after two attempts, this is clearly not what I'm looking for.
author: derek t.

description:
Bland and boring. Tasteless. No flavor, and kind of watery.

But I have a craving for Mexican food and this place delivers. Since I don't want to miss the beginning of True Blood, I guess I'll just order from here and add tons of hot sauce.
author: Kay H.

description: Sure, it's fun to call the place La Ca-nasty, but I love it!  It's dependable, reliable, and consistent...oh, and tasty.  You want a chicken burrito that taste as delicious today as the same order will taste next week?  This is your spot.  Sure, it's not flashy and the parking blows harder than....well, you know the city, fill in your own words, but the food is good enough to keep me coming back every week.
author: Matt L.

description:
The friendly, hot guy behind the counter made our day (My sister and I dropped in for burritos yesterday). Close to lululemon which could be dangerous for the wallet, but otherwise good location. 
The chicken is tender and the burritos generous for the price, but I would like more salsa inside for sure.
author: Kyla L.

description:
I used to drive cross town for their chicken burritos, but its been not so great the last few times, so its not worth the drive.  

I would totally eat here again if i was in the Marina.

Best Pick: Chicken Burrito
author: Ken p.

description: Ordered over the phone, was ready when I got there. Dealt with a friendly, very sweet woman for both. Had the Grande Vegetariano Burrito. Delicious!
author: Tania S.

description: slooooow. but worth it. good burritos and mexican cokes. stingy on the napkins but  you guys still get 5 stars.
author: Lera D.

description: I was skeptical about ordering from this place after reading the reviews, but was burned out on Victor's and Wok Shop so decided to try it.  Maybe my house is closer than some of the other reviewers, but the food was here 20 minutes after I ordered.  The salad with jicama and avocado was fantastic, and the grilled chicken super burrito was exactly what I expected (not little chihuahua great, but good - spicy, filling, fresh).  I'll be putting them in the rotation for nights when I work too late to deal with cooking.
author: Katie P.

description: I eat here every day, sometimes twice a day - I love it!  It's healthy, light, and so delicious!  I think many taquerias are hit or miss but this place is def a HIT.  No mystery meat, nothing you can't identify...just a whole lotta goodness!
author: Romea M.

description:
Overall, I give this place one star:
1 star- fresh ingredients
1 star- wicked nachos (grilled chicken/beef not the shredded)
1 star- they deliver
1 star- decent portions
minus 3 stars- whenever I order ANYTHING different, the bill comes out to 50 dollars. okay not 50 dollars but you get the pic. like nachos and burrito for 20 bucks. 
So, it's really about convenience and jonesing for Mexican food and  you're too lazy to cook it or too lazy to go get it...
UPDATE: ordered again - got the taquitos and a burrito and it cost me 16.90... how the hell does that happen??? bad dog. one star for you.
author: Raul L.

description: My boyfriend and I were driving out of the city and parked on Union to find something to eat. We saw La Canasta and since we LOVE hole-in-the-wall Mexican food places, we went in. I got black beans with Spanish rice, SO good. Very friendly, quick service. We were traveling so the takeout container was greatly appreciated and very useful. The portions are a little smaller and more pricier than what I'm used to but it was worth it, because the rice had corn and peas mixed in and was delicious. We will definitely be going back next time we are in the neighborhood! The free chips were icing on the cake.
author: Melisande H.

description: Great place for a quick lunch or dinner when you are in a hurry. I love the veggie burritos.
author: Sandra Q.

description:
Oh where do I begin!?  This place would get a decent rating for the food but if it wasn't for the service.  My Girlfriend and I actually love the guacamole from here and thats the reason they are getting a star at all.  It all went down hill from there, one night they failed to call the right number (which was provided) and didn't bring us our food.  What happened the next time we ordered you ask?  The owner fussed out my girlfriend for not getting the food, WTF.  Tonight was our last straw after a few other incidents, tonight honestly pissed me off.   After 2 HOURS, we called to see what the hold up was, they assured us it was on its way.  That was a lie, 39 minutes later no food so we called again and asked what was going on.  The owner apologized and said they were now sending the food, WTF. The owner calls me as I am in the elevator heading down to get the food (I live on the 11th floor which takes a few minutes to get to the first!) fusses me out for not being at the door and her delivery person was out in the cold waiting for me.  Oh she was waiting all of maybe 6 minutes, please we waited 2 HOURS for your F***ing food to arrive and your complaining about 6 minutes for me to get to the first floor??  Yes it gets worse!  Once I paid for the food and got back up stairs, un packing the food and guess what?  Yup thats right our whole order wasn't there.  We paid for 4 drinks and didn't receive any!  We also ordered two quesadillas which was actually just ONE cut in half to make two WTF!!!!

SERIOUSLY some of the WORST service i have EVER had!!!
Take this review as a warning to anyone thinking about ordering food from here.
author: Michael W.

description: Awesome, fast and delicious Mexican food.
author: Lucy H.

description:
The boyfriend and I ordered a regular carnitas burrito. Verdict? Bad. I was buzzed and this place didn't even taste good at all and SO expensive. +$7 for a REGULAR burrito? What are they thinking?! Ugh.

All it had was dry carnitas, a sprinkle of rice, smeared refried beans, a dash of "salsa," and a pinch of hot sauce? Oh, and the tortilla was barely warm. Yeah....for $7, I expect a hot one.

The issues:
- No choice in beans. I hate refried beans because they don't have any texture....
- Where's the salsa?! I felt like I only had a piece or two of tomatoes for every huge bite I took and um...I need my onions and cilantro in my salsa.
-Yeah....the rice...it fails.
-The hot sauce...it's non existent. I asked for medium spicy and I didn't taste ANY!! ahhhhh!! DISAPPOINTING!!!

Bottom line:
Gordo's is still my hero. Cheaper, better, and bigger. Oh, and they steam their tortilla to warm it up so it's om nom nom hot!! yay!
author: S. H.

description:
I live up the road from La Canasta and was happy I discovered yummy authentic Mexican food in walking distance. La Canasta uses fresh ingredients and cooks to order. My tostada and tamale was superb! Please go and enjoy some great authentic Mexican food. Those who say the food here is bland need a tongue cleaner, because they must enjoy lard and chili paste with their tacos.

I am just sad they close around 9- too early for most cravings. I tend to want great Mexican food around midnight. !En el La Canasta el alimento es fresco y delicioso!
author: Ronnie Ray H.

description: Close to my house, but disappointedly not that great.  My chicken burrito was watery and pretty flavorless.  The shrimp ceviche was a joke and consisted mostly of salsa.  The chips were nice and crispy and about the only thing good about my meal.  I will give it another try though....maybe it was an off night.  The staff was nice though!
author: Carolyn D.

description:
I would have given this place a "zero" star if I could, but one-star is the lowest grade Yelp would allow me.

Anyway, I made an order from this place last night through a delivery website.  The order was placed shortly after 7pm, my food didn't get to my house until 9:15pm.  I was so starved when I was waiting, I had to cook myself some good-old-fashion instant Ramen noodles to hold me over.

When the guy finally delivered the food, I was tempted to just tell him not to bother.  But I didn't because I was being nice.  However when I checked the food I got, my buritto had no cheese like I specified.  The other items were either too salty or too hard.  What a total disappointment!  Never again  I would order anything from this place!!!
author: Jason A.

description:
Did you ever live in SoCal and eat the Mexican food? Well then my friend this is the closest you'll get to a burrito from down there. The mission doesn't taste like SoCal, which is understandable

Also, I get the Machaca sometimes and night, and they don't judge my gringo ways.
author: Tom Y.

description: At least its not Los Hermanos?? I eat here all the time.  And begrudgingly, I will continue to eat here all the time, until my Sunday hang-out spot changes and its no longer simply the best CLOSEST option.  I've developed a certain fondness for the cherubic well-fed people behind the counter and feel bad trashing "The Basket" too hard, but the truth is La Canasta is another reason why the marina and the mission are worlds apart.
author: Michael M.

description:
I have been going here for over 20 years.  One of the many places that make living in Pac Heights/Marina so GREAT.
This is real Mexican food made by a super nice Mexican family.
FYI-take out only ,order by phone to save time.
author: Christopher B.

description: Maybe the peopl who like this place haven't stepped outside the marina and tried good mexican food in the mission or elsewhere. This was bad. Really bad. The worst part? The attitude I got. I didn't even know they existed until I got a scoutmob coupon for it. I went in on a Saturday and ordered the super camaron (shrimp) burrito then said I have a scoutmob coupon. The elderly lady behind the cashier had no idea what I was talking about. The other elderly lady didn't either. Communication was nearly impossible with the language barrier. After I showed her my phone with the coupon, she very rudely asked how I delete it so that I don't use it a second time. I told her I won't use it a second time (if they were keeping track of the coupon codes they wouldn't have to ask this). She made me feel like a criminal for trying to use this coupon. At this point i wanted to just leave but they had already started cooking. Once I deleted the text with the coupon on my phone and proved it to her (yes, she made me show her!) I go to the cashier and guess what? For my $9 burrito which should have been half off, she charges me $7.00! I protested for a second and the lady (this is the grandma i think) really rudely said some nonsense about having to have spent $20 dollars or something.. I just said forget it and let them charge me $7.00. When I went back in to get my burrito, she handed me $2 bucks. But too little too late. Oh, and the burrito was nasty. Lots of white heavy cream sauce and refried beans. Barely ate half.
author: Misty M.

description:
Soooo good. Great little spot to get some authentic Mexican food. Its a to go place where you can get awesome carne asada burritos. They also have Mexican Coke with is awesome. 

This a great spot for good to go Mexican - cant wait to go back.
author: Richard C.

description: I can say the owners are some of the nicest, hard-working people you will meet (especially in the privileged Cow Hollow).  I can't say the food is spectacular.  The tortillas on the burritos tend to split easily.  The food is "clean" tasting, if that makes sense.... not orange like the taqueria meat in the Mission (while I enjoy that at times).  So my review is mostly about the people who work there, who have my picky little ordering down to a science.
author: regina k.

description: For me La Canasta was always just that Mexican food place next to Jamba Juice/Cultive but I recently tried it and it was really good. I had the fajitas which were very good and my friend got a steak burrito. we both tried each others and both were delectable. This place is small and seemed to be busy but they were fast so it all evened out. this  place was yummy and should be tried.
author: Amy J.

description: Pretty good! It's not too expensive. It's not too spicey, not all that interesting, but it is authentic and has this nice authentic taste/feel to the whole thing. I would highly recommend their burritos!
author: Clare R.

description: Good burritos, not great but will do in a pinch, especially if you live in the 'hood.  It's always crowded but the line moves fast.  If you don't like a busy signal don't bother trying to call and place an order to go!
author: phil h.

description: Best burrito in the area.  Only caution is that everything is made to order, so sometimes takes a while.  I usually call ahead.  The staff is always very nice and friendly.  Highly recommended.
author: S H.

description: This is your average SF taqueria, I'm not sure what everybody's yelping excitedly about.  The girl gave me a dirty look when I asked her for a little extra cheese on my burrito.  You can't deny a guy with a mighty boiler such as mine a little extra dairy lovin' on my burrito.  I mean come on, that's no way to build your customer base.  Super time-consuming too.
author: Rick H.

description: I think the men and women of the Marina need to expand their horizons because this place is horrid! The burritos were absolutely tasteless and they don't even steam the tortilla. Don't they realize the secret to a San Francisco Burrito is the steamer? It allows the toritilla to expand and made its soft and palatable! It doesn't help that the beans tasted like refried beans from your typical HungryMan tv dinner, and the Nachos always made my coworkers go straight to the toilet. I know this review sounds harsh but thats the point, to persuade you, the consumer, from not coming to this place. The only time I would eat there is when me and My coworkers were able to trade a smoothie for a burrito, and even then it wasn't a guarantee. They also took forever to make a burrito.
author: Harry B.

description: I went here to get lunch one afternoon when I got out of a class and I was expecting it would be good because of the convenient location. I was wrong. The food here was awful! Very dry, BLAND, and eating a burrito here tasted like chewing on a mix of rubber and tofu. I don't recommend this place but it usually gets crowded.
author: Brandon H.

description: I've been here numerous times in the last few years.  90% of the time the food is great, 10% it has something to be desired.  The nachos are consistently good, ceviche has always been great, and the burritos are usually good, but not guaranteed.  The best part of La Canasta is the people who work here.  They're always friendly and welcoming despite being crowded.  I grew up in an area with great Mexican food and La Canasta makes me feel right at home.
author: Alexia M.

description:
First, the people who run this place are the nicest people on the planet.  They're always welcoming and friendly, ask how my dog is, yada yada.  Second, the service is very efficient.  And the place seems spotlessly clean.  You just have to look at the owner's wife to know that she would insist on a clean restaurant - she's always immaculate.

Next, the food.  The ingredients are wholesome and fresh but I have to agree with previous reviewers who say that it's bland.  It's by far the blandest Mexican food I have ever eaten!  It's a pity, but there ya go!  

I myself prefer Los Hermanos down on Chestnut between Fillmore and Mallorca.  Is it genuine Mexican?  Heck if I know (or care), but it's delicious.
author: Alexandra D.

description: Hands down my favorite place to get a burrito in the city.  Make sure you ask for whole beans if you want them becasue they use refried by default.  Anything on the grill is delish!
author: Katherine s.

description: Rip off, spent 8.50 for a grande carnitas burrito and wasnt full at all. The burrito looked like a taco, not coming here again.
author: Jonah G.

description: Can't beat the tacos here.  Great marina mexican food, however, it can take a while to get the food.  Most people feel free to double park along buchanan street, so until the cops start ticketing, i would definately call it in and pick it up.
author: Robert R.

description: I like it.  Big, gut-busting burritos of the Mission variety.  I particularly like the carne asada, grilled while you wait.  It's location of 4 blocks from my flat is particularly nice.
author: darla s.

description: Excellent "neighborhood" burrito place, that has fast become a staple of my patented 3-burrito a week diet.  Call ahead, if you can, especially on weeknights.  Doesn't quite measure up to some of the more well-known places in the Mission, but then again, you're in Cow Hollow. . .
author: Peter R.

description:
best burrito around the marina without a question.
the guy that owns it is the nicest guy in the world, and they have the mexican coke!! sweet!!
author: Scott K.

description: There are many great burro shops in SF - mostly in the Mission of course - but this is not one of them.  There are a lot of positive reviews listed here, but I'd argue that the 'Canasty' is completely overrated simply because of its location.  I've eaten their burritos several times because its so convenient, but generally the food is really bland and serves as little more than filler.  I'd like to mix up my orders and try something new, but their menu is extremely limited.  Plus they close sort of early.  Somebody ought to open another take-out autentica Taq.Cancun-style Mexi place in the Cow Hollow area and give them a real run for their money.  Bottom line: if you're kicking it on Union Street, you didn't come for the burritos.
author: Ryan W.

description: Good spot if you want something quick (well not that quick) to go.  Not the place to go for ambiance, unless you want to read all the tacky business cards next to the register.  Enjoy this place for what it is, pretty good Mexican (especially the burritos, get them a little spicy) for the Marina/Cow Hollow district.
author: Tom C.

description: I've had an intervention with myself and can finally come to grips with the fact that the burritos at La Canasta are not good.  I've been eating at La Canasta for about two years, but admitted their subpar offering only tonight after doing Taqueria Cancun and La Canasta burritos on consecutive evenings.  Compared to Taqueria Cancun, La Canasta's carne asada and grilled chicken are consistently overcooked,  the beans are mealy, much of the rice included in the burrito tastes like was stuck to the sides of the warming tray for a while, the guacamole doesn't taste fresh, and the spicy salsa is anything but.  While La Canasta may just be catering to its target market with its blander offerings, I say we need to draw a line in the sand and ask for more flavor from our Marina burritos.  Or build a conveyor belt from Taqueria Cancun to Union Street.
author: Kevin G.

description: Great burritos! I'm especially a big fan of the Carnitas Grande. Perfect for a quick meal anytime. Very friendly.
author: Ross W.

description: I've been patronizing La Canasta for over 20 years...which seeing as I was born in the 1980s is saying something. This is usually the last place I stop before a long flight because their burritos make great plane food. Success here is a matter of knowing a simple secret: call your order in advance. I'm a particular fan of the excellent shrimp burritos and the garden burritos-for my money the best veggie burrito in town. If you are in the Marina and the urge for Mexican food strikes this is the best choice.
author: Cameron K.

description: Quick and delicious, its the only decent Mexican food I've found in the Marina.
author: Kelly C.

description: It's a shame that such a conveniently located little Mexican joint is so mediocre. Quesadilla was small, burnt, and had hardly any cheese. Tomale was weak, torta was okay... even the salsa tasted gross. I'm a Mexican girl, I love Mexican food, and it makes me sad to leave a negative review, but for reals... do better! Looks like you DO have to venture into the Mission district to get cheap delicious Mexican food. Going back to Taqueria Cancun or El Farolito!
author: Joyce P.

description:
I live right across the street from la canasta, so I tried really hard to like it when I ate here.  I ordered a basic veggie burrito and we waited over 20 minutes for our food.  

This would have been fine if it was worth it...too bad the food was bland, bland, bland.  Both of our items were way too oily and basically tasteless, so we ended up tossing.  

How is it possible that this place is so popular?
author: Shilpa G.

description:
The food is good, but delivery is O-U-T!!!  I joined Yelp just to write a scathing review about this place.  First of all no one speaks english, so it's no wonder they get your order wrong.  But then heaven forbid that they do not get it right, they have definitely never gotten the memo that the customer is always right.  I paid for 2 burrittos and a quesadilla and they delivered 1 and then it was my problem when I asked them to deliver what I paid for (which they never did).  The lady then proceeded to berrade me in spanish and it was all in all what you would hope for in a delivery experience (if you don't sense the sarcasm, you have problems).  

I know there are limited options for delivery in the marina, but trust me when I tell you another night of pizza is better than this place --because at least you'll get to eat!
author: Kate o.

description: pretty good for the MArina and it has an at home feeling. WTF do you expect? This is not the Mission or Robertos.
author: Bryan M.

description: Excellent mexican delivery. The burritos are excellent, as is the pozole and other soups. The delivery time is pretty fast usually also. Try the tacos with refried beans added to them - very yummy.
author: Brian B.

description: I have lived about 100 feet from this place for 2.5 years and I rarely go here. I've tried it about 5 times usually as a last resort. The prices are way too high. For two chicken quesadillas with two cans of coke it's $16.64! Are you kidding me. I like Mexican food and I'm disappointed that there aren't other choices near by.
author: Cow H.

description: Just like everyone else has said, really nice staff, really bland food.  I was angry at myself for eating my burrito since it tasted like nothing...I even asked for extra spicy salsa...but I was ravenous and didn't have time to get another lunch.  I will not be going back to La Canasta...sad that there is no good Mexican food in this area.
author: Nilu r.

description: Love the Mom & Pop feel - service is always dependable BUT the parking sucks as its right off Union. Its not fancy by ANY means but its good.
author: Devon F.

description: Other than delivery taking 55 minutes, food was alright. I am not really a mexican food guy, but it did the job. They told me the delivery took about 35 minutes and I live 5 mins driving distance from them. Yet, it took them 55 minutes.
author: Kerem S.

description: ok... I order take out a lot... I mean A LOT! I love this place! Nachos Mexicanos... SUPER YUMMY with the grilled steak! Ummm.... I just had these last night and I could eat it again! I'm so happy that I'm moving back to the neighborhood so I can be closer! Your order usually comes in 1/2 hour! Excellent!!!!!
author: Jodi B.

description: There is always a line of double parked cars infront of this tiny little taqueria.  I've tried the chicken burrito twice.  The first time was so good.  The chicken was seasoned and grilled, then drizzled with some kind of orange colored sauce.  It was so good I ate the whole thing and it wasn't my food.  Ooops!  My BF went hungry.  The second time, maybe I ordered wrong but it was crap.  The burrito was cold, tasteless and gave me heartburn.  My boyfriend who eats here three times a week suggests ordering from the old man.  He makes the good burritos.
author: Jeanne C.

description:
the garden vegetable burrito is gross.  thye use frozen vegetables in it.  sick.  its really sick.  but then again, maybe a garden burrito is just suppoed to suck everywhere.  its kind of like asking for a uncarbonated cola or an unalcoholic  beer.  but anwyays, burrito sucked.  

my friend really liked her chicken burrito though and the nacho was good.
author: Wakako U.

description: It's an ok burrito if you have an hour to spare.  Yes, an hour!  Definitely not fast food for a hole in the wall place.  So don't go here if you are in a hurry, you might as well use the time to drive across town to the mission district where you can get an authentic, tasty and reasonably priced meal.  For the price the portions are small and lack flavor.
author: barry w.

description: YUM YUM YUM!!! the best most authentic mexican ive had in the city! super small, so its a PICK UP place, ive never had it delivered, but why not walk? besides youll be gorging yourself on their delish nachos, tacos, enchiladas anyways! super affordable and great food i am a HUGE fan!
author: Jess L.

description: Like Carnitas?  Me too, until I decided to order it via delivery from La Canasta.  Said carnitas arrived dry, hard, and after trying to stomach a couple bites I drank about a gallon of water with the hopes of flushing some of the sodium from my body.  I rarely complain about food, but the order cost me upwards of $25, so I wanted to let them know what i thought and see if I could at least get a credit for something else.  I called and spoke with who I believe may have been the owner, and she said she would send the delivery guy back to pick up the remainder of my food so they could "inspect the meat". They did offer to send me a new order, but that made my stomach turn.  Wow.  Ok, so I send it back and don't hear anything back for a couple weeks.  I called a couple times, but got a spanish speaking lady who hung up on me both times.  I decided to call back one more time about a week later and ended up speaking to the owner.  She graciously graciously credited me.  One star is for her accommodation and the other is for the sweet delivery guy who told me that sometimes the carnitas is old.  Honestly gets you stars **
author: Amie W.

description: Great, fresh, made-to-order burritos, and they're around the corner from my house.  What more could I ask for?  Oh, fyi - There's no where to sit here except a bench outside, so everything is to-go.
author: Lindsay B.

description: I'm surprised to see so many negative Yelps about this one. The food is very good for the price, which is dirt cheap. I would agree that the burritos are not the best, for all the same reasons other Yelpers have listed. I have found the hidden gem though, and it is the Carnitas meal. For the Marina types that may not know what Carnitas are, it is shredded pork that is fried in grease. If you get the full meal with either corn or flour tortillas, you can build your own mini tacos with carnitas, refried beans, rice, guac and pico de gallo. A little on the salty side, but totally delish.
author: Matt H.

description: sadly I must say, even though the owner is incredibly kind and friendly, their food isn't that great. That is, its not that spicy or flavorful, I feel like they may be dulling it down a bit, even when I ask for spicy its not that hot!  The little girl I nanny for LOVES this place and has to go every week for a bean and cheese burrito, which I thinks speaks greatly about La Canasta. If a picky child that only eats bread and sweets likes it, there's not a lot of flavor, sorry La Canasta, your a nice place but I'm going to get my Mexican kick somewhere else.
author: Meg L.

description: I just do not understand the high ratings here.  To me, a proper burrito should be full of flavor and always leave you satisfied.  I feel like the burritos here are terribly bland and the tacos are mushy.   Why waste calories on this stuff?  For good mexican food, avoid Cow Hollow.
author: Lisa C.

description: it was ok, they deliver and that's a rarity for mexican food. definitely curbed by fix for taqueria for the moment. the meat plate was good, burrito so so, guac really good, tortilla soup no so much..
author: Nicole H.

description: family owned,  fresh food that is affordable - I love it
author: scott g.

description: Dependable - I've been coming to this place for years.  I call ahead to La Canasta nearly once a week so I can swing by on my way home from work.  Some people love the burritos, but I love the California Chicken taco.  Two are always the perfect amount.  The nachos are indulgent.  Don't forget to tell them what kind of salsa you want.  Excellent prices and friendly people!  I love the man & women switch off answering the phones/take your orders!  No nonsense hole-in-the-wall place.  Just stay away from the burritos.
author: kristen h.

description: Although I am not a fan of shredded chicken, somehow, some way, this place manages to pull it off.  I don't know how -- perhaps it's all the other ingredients that mask it, but it is quite a tasty taco they're kicking out.
author: Tim G.

description: My favorite is the Chile Colorado. And they are open during the lunch hours. Saved my hangover on multiple occasions.
author: Geoff R.

description: IF you are calling in a delivery and do not get alberto hang up they will get your order wrong.  Used to be fast cheap and good but the prices have gone up and the food just does not seem near what it used to be..
author: michael h.

description: I was delighted to see mexican food in Cow Hollow and glad to know it's decent enough for those nights I just want a taco or burrito.  I've tried the shredded beef taco (not great) but the shrimp taco and fajita steak taco is quite tasty.  It's nice to know that I'm helping a mom & pop shop continue in business - very nice people!   Tortillas are ok - easy to break unfortunately.
author: Lily W.

description: The BEST crispy tacos in town.  Everything else is fantastic too!  The owner is always there and a very sweet man!
author: Shannyn K.

description: Damn good burritos. Nice guy who runs the place. Pretty fast too.
author: Dandy O.

description: This place is the pits.  The service was awful.  It took forever for the older woman at the counter to get off the phone and take our f'ing order.  The food was bland, and over priced.  In addition, when we walked in, people were eating at the counter.  When our food was ready, we proceeded to do the same, but were told to leave.  Told to leave!!  Paying customers doing nothing more than the customers ahead of us by eating at the counter.  Extremely rude people selling over-priced, bland food. Paassss.
author: Steph H.

description:
With some expectation, I ordered my grande burrito, and walked over to pick it up.  The walk was enjoyable, the burrito (and chips) were not. The burrito was a lot of beans and rice.  The meat was spicy, but not in a flavorful way. The chips were borderline stale (but two thumbs up on the salsa).

Next time I get a hankering to not eat leftovers for lunch, I'll walk around the corner to that organic grocer and spend my $8 on a wholesome sando.
author: walking b.

description: Best fresh Mexican North of Market Street!  Wonderful family-owned neighborhood place.
author: Elizabeth C.

description: Great food, prepared with pride, and great pricing. I don't know about other people's issues, but they were ridiculously friendly when i went. recommended!
author: surya y.

description: Um, this take-out restaurant's website clearly promotes delivery but don't bother trying to have them deliver to you. They "are not delivering tonight"... Really - on a Saturday???
author: Al K.

description: this was my favorite mexican take-out place when my family lived in cow-hollow five years ago.   I now live in the Richmond, but still go back three or four times a year because of the quality of the food.    Every dish that I've had there is excellent.  The fajitas are made to order -  nicely grilled and marinated, the salsa is fresh and piquant, the carnitas are lean, tasty and substantial, the rice is carefully prepared - light and flavorful, the beans have been simmered slowly and taste like beans. .   Alberto and his team take great care in making each dish  in a refined way.   I'm not trying to put down the detractors of this place,  but La Canasta is not the kind of hole in wall where you get a big greasy burrito full of hot sauce and cheesy gooeyness -    You actually have to sit down( at home)  and enjoy each bite and taste the spices which compliment each dish.   End it all with a nice sweet dessert tamale - filled with masa, raisins, and coconuts -  enjoy
author: Wilfred L.

description: Finally a place with authentic mexican food at decent prices. The staff is very friendly and they are generally pretty quick. there was only once where i waited more then 5 minutes. the only reason i'm giving them 4 stars instead of 5 is their chilli relleno burrito wasn't as good as i had hoped.
author: Jenna R.

description: A very small taqueria just off Union... They offer traditional Mexican options for take-out or delivery.  The owners are extremely friendly and the food is excellent (the menu hasn't been as "Americanized" as some others, but you can make any special requests and they're happy to make it for you).  Y se puede practicar espanol!
author: Zach L.

description: YUM. I love this place. Their burritos are delicious. If you get the chicken burrtio - get it spicy!!! AND - they deliver!!! Burritto delivery = best thing ever.
author: Amy A.

description: Great mom and pop Mexican food.  It's a small restaurant...to go food only, but it is very good.  The owners are very kind and polite.  It was reasonably priced too.  I crushed the steak fajita burrito and it was large and tasty.  I'm a bit spoiled being from so cal where the Mexican food is top notch, but this place is about as good as it gets in San Fran.  They don't have beer, but that is okay cuz you will get it to go...give it a try, it is muy delicioso.
author: Chris P.

description: I've been eating at La Canasta for (gasp!) over 15 years now and I am absolutely shocked to see that not every review on this is 5 stars.  La Canasta is one of about maybe 5 taquerias in all of SF I dare to eat in (and I'm a native so trust me I've tried them all).  I would so much rather drive all the way over to the Marina district then try my fate at almost any of the taquerias in the Mission (exception: Papalote).  First off they grill their meats to order, not in bulk to wither in bins for hours.  There's no grease, just chicken or steak and grill.  They use breast meat rather than whatever they can scrape off a chicken (which usually includes bones and cartilage at other tqrias).  You can blindfold yourself and try anything on the menu as all is delicious and won't leave you wondering what hit you in the stomach an hour later.  I'm particularly fond of the enchiladas, tacos and burritos.  For the people that complain about costs, I can only say you get what you pay for.  If you are not finicky about the quality of the food you eat, by all means save the $2 and head to the Mission; but if you're like me and don't want to gag on semi-warm, haphazardly cleaned, second-grade meat, for the love of Mexican food, eat here.  P.S. the family that runs the place are very congenial.
author: K K.

description:
The best steak burritos I have ever had (have it with salsa picante)! We have been regular to La Canasta for more than a year and we crave those burritos every week. California style tacos are yummy as well and the whole team ( a very warm family) is very accommodating. 
Neighborhood is an irrelevant factor in this case b/c we have been to many places in Mission and La Canasta honestly kicks butt. 
I wish they were bigger or had a sit down joint :)
Love them, period.
author: Milena A.

description: Over the years, La Canasta has become overpriced and bland.  There is nothing "authentic" about their food.  They are skimpy on their meats and fill the burritos mostly with rice and beans.  If you want to add sour cream, cheese and guacamole it adds up to over $9 for an average size burrito.  That is way overpriced for below average Mexican food.  If you have money to burn, burn it there otherwise go elsewhere.
author: Dean P.

description: be really cool if their phones worked. just wasted half an hour trying to get through. that was fun.
author: Andrew T.

description: It's just not the same as San Diego mexican food I'm sorry. The service was so nice and it was a super cute little cove, those are usually the best, but it didn't wow me. I had a tostada and it felt cold. They put tomato slices in it. Like full on tomato slices. Not my style. I'd consider this more of a drunk food post triangle bars kinda place. Might go again when I'm too lazy to walk too far. Prices were pretty decent too.
author: Andrea S.

description: Went in last night because I was really craving Mexican food and I didn't want to go all the way to the Mission. I can't believe I've never been in to this place being that it's around the corner from house! It was excellent (for Cow Hollow). I refuse to go get crap in a tortilla from Los Hermanos and I can't believe why in the world anyone would rate Los Hermanos higher than La Canasta...must be from total lack of knowledge of what constitutes good Mexican food, or impairment of judgment from alcohol while consuming said Mexican food. Anyway, the chile relleno burrito was good, and the carnitas grande burrito was excellent. The carnitas were well made, melt-in-your mouth tender, well trimmed (no fatty pieces), and juicy and beans were great. Not "refried" in the traditional fried-in-lard sense, just "refried" as in mashed up pinto beans. I have an affinity for this kind of refried beans because that's how my mama makes them. The place was very clean and the service was excellent. I think I finally found my local comfort food/take-out spot.
author: Dee I.

description: Good not great authentic Mexican. Fairly inexpensive - perfectly good for what it is: a hole-in-the-wall burrito spot. Take-out only but great neighborhood spot that now delivers.
author: Lauren J.

description: I had the pollo grande burrito and thought it lacked in flavor and got pretty limp and watery. No thanks.
author: Elizabeth C.

description:
my first review! that's what having nothing to do at work leads to. anyway.
la canasta is across the street from where i live, so it was inevitable that i would one day give it a try. doesn't look so bad from the outside, looks like one of those hole in the wall ethnic food places that's authentic/good. i went there with my roommate and i ordered a chili relleno burrito. we waited for about 20 minutes for our food to come. that's fine, they had just opened up so they were preparing their ingredients.
onto the food. so bland. sooo bland. there was just no flavor. even the cheese was tasteless, if that's even possible. i ate 3 bites and threw the rest out. maybe it is authentic, but it's definitely not good. there are sooo many better mexican places in sf. and it's not just limited to the mission district even. for example, i would say taco bell, which is a couple blocks away, is much better than la canasta. so go there instead if you want mexcian food.
author: Jessica W.

description: Well I don't know where people are coming up with this "bland" stuff unless they think all Mexican food is supposed to be overly spicy and hot. For me, if the food is too spicy I can't taste it.  All I get is heat.  Anyway, I tried this place for the first time and liked it. It smelled just like an authentic Mexican kitchen and for good reason--the people cooking the food know what they're doing.  I tried a cheese enchilada, a vegetarian taco, rice and pinto beans and they were all very good.  The owner told me she doesn't use any lard and I was happy to hear that.  My order came up fast, the staff is friendly and the place is clean.  As for the prices, it is unreal how inexpensive the food is.  I got a full meal for under $8. Next time I plan to try their chile relleno and will test out the veggie burrito which will be real soon I'm sure.  They even have a veggie torta.  I would recommend La Canasta without a doubt. They've been in business for years and it shows.
author: Rabbit B.

description: Great mexican food. Outstanding taste at a reasonable price. Try the chalupas for a real treat. Everything else is great too.
author: Chris K.

description: Been here a few times now.  I have to agree with alot of the other reviewers in that the people behind the counter are extraordinarily friendly.  The food however isn't the greatest.  So far the fajita steak burrito is the only one i would say is above average (had it w/ everything plus extra spicy).  The chicken and carnitas burritos were very forgettable, and borderline unenjoyable.
author: Ethan K.

description: I never ate burritos before this place.  They converted me from a taco lover to a burrito lover.  Awsome burritos and nice service.  They tend to get busy at lunchtime but that is only because this place is so good.
author: Les L.

description: Every neighborhood in the city has its good burrito place, yes?  NO!  The Marina lacks this simple and wonderful convenience.  After 3 months of living here and trying to convince myself that La Canasta is decent, I have officially given up.  The food is bland, the place is not clean, and the staff doesn't seem to really care much.  Sometimes I get pinto beans, sometimes refried beans - but NEVER do they ask for your preference.  They do ask if you want hot sauce - and I always say yes - but I have yet to taste it.  The clincher came yesterday when I found a mysterious hard object in my burrtio.  Kind of like a miniature peach pit.  Gross.  I really wish this place was just decent, but no dice.
author: Green T.

description: So I ask my friend what she's doing for lunch and she said she was heading to Union St (from the CIvic Cntr) to go to her FAVORITE burrito/taco place.  I tried to convince her to at least try Papolotte, but noooooo.  So, I figure, what the hell.  I'm a veggie, so I check out their menu, black beans, that's good and two choices.  The vegetariano and the garden veggie.  I opt for the g.v. and after a LENGTHY wait (in fact, my friend's food was sitting there for five to ten minutes before my burrito was done) I got the WORSE BURRITO I HAVE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE.  It was BLAND black beans, blander rice and the blandest veggies ever.  NO SALSA, DRY to the bone and tasteless.  The tortilla was sticky, gummy steamed, not grilled crispy.  Holy Christ, what a fucking waste.  And, to top it off, my friend was bitching  about how bad her taco and salad were.  How the fuck do you fuck up a salad?  Oh, and to top it off, they forgot to give me my change.  Ah, yeah, I don't think I will be back there UNLESS I get alzheimers.
author: AJ L.
